campaign.story:
Pg. 1 from OneNation: Stronghold #1
In OneNation the Tenth are a group of Keramats (metahumans) whose interventionist philanthropy rocks the world's status quo to its foundations. This volume tells the origin of Stronghold, the Tenth's resident muscle, growing up in rural Louisiana while coming to terms with his sexuality and his racist family history.
OneNation: Stronghold #1 will be a 23-page, full color comic. For ages 15 and up.
Pg. 2 from OneNation: Stronghold #1
Pg. 10 from OneNation: Stronghold #1
Since 2012 it has been our mission to create the stories we wanted to see in comics and media in general. Stories inclusive to minority voices with Black protagonists, villains, superheroes, and gods with their own agencies.  OneNation was the very first comic we published with that in mind and we're thrilled to be bringing you more action, adventure, and drama, from Sundiata, Paragon, and the rest of the Tenth!
Pg. 15 from OneNation: Stronghold #1
Pg. 18 from OneNation: Stronghold #1
Pg. 20 from OneNation: Stronghold #1
OneNation: Stronghold #1 (Cover A)
OneNation: Stronghold #1 (Cover B)
OneNation: Stronghold #1 (Cover C)
 Damian Strong AKA Stronghold
Damian Strong AKA Stronghold is our hero. One part of the group of superhero organization the Tenth. Damian is also what is known as a Keramat, a person on born with extraordinary abilities. In Damian's case he possesses superhuman strength and durability. Damian (and his twin sister Daisy) also have Albinism, defined as a lack of pigmentation in the eyes, skin, and/or hair.
Damian grew up in rural Louisiana in a prosperous family of alligator hunters.
Damian (young)
All his life Damion was always taught to hide. As a kid he hid from his older brothers' wrathful hazing because he was the youngest boy. Living in a small bigoted town as a mixed-race kid where he and Daisy were forced by their parents to straighten their kinky hair so they could pass for white, Damian was raised to hide his Blackness.

He hid his growing Keramat abilities from his family fearing that it would hurt his family's image and as a young man coming into his own, hiding from his own sexuality. But soon there would come a reckoning, and Damian would have to face all the things that make him. In order to be the hero he could be, to become Stronghold, Damian will have to realize himself.
Daisy Strong (young)
Damian’s twin sister and his rock. Daisy knows all Damian's secrets but still has a few of her own she's has yet to reveal. She was always faster to adapt to situations in their tumultuous family, and is the more independent of the twins. Daisy also has Albinism. In their youth she was also made to straighten her hair, but has learned to let it grow and become kinky, embracing her Blackness as she got older. Now, a doctor who works closely with Mansa with all to help solve medical heath issues related to Keramats.
Randall
Randall and Damien meet when Damian leaves home for college. Not afraid to wear his sexuality on his sleeve, his truth is jarring to young Damian who's never been out of the watchful eye of the conservative Strong family.
Optical
Stronghold’s right hand on the Tenth's away team is Optical. A Black woman with the ability to blast heat beams from her eyes, x-ray vision, and other eye based abilities. She's a model soldier and always ready for the smoke.
Shielder & Surge
Rounding out Stronghold's away team are Shielder and Surge. Shielder's Keramat ability allows him to create constructs of energy he uses as force fields to cover/ and protect. 
Surge's Keramat ability let's her convert the adrenaline in her body to pure energy she can project from her hands. 
 Mansa
AKA the Nation. The Keramat home base.
The Strongs
The Patriarch of the family Alton Strong is a hard, callous man, who took a generations old tradition of alligator hunting and expanded it into a franchise of hunting/sporting good stores, restaurants, and eventually a conservative-style reality TV show called: Keeping the Faith Strong.

Brittany Strong is the matriarch. A stone cold woman who values appearances over the well being of even her own children. She is furious at her husband's infidelity and is mortified when Alton decides to take his out of wedlock, mixed race kids into the family. Her rancor for the twins manifested in punishing them when they weren't acting 'Christian enough' and denying them their cultural awareness, even forcing them to cut or change the texture of their hair to appear more “white.” 

Junior and Davis Strong are sociopaths who exist to please their father, as you all will soon see.
Blabbermouth
Of South Asian descent, Blabbermouth's Keramat abilities work similar to Optical's with one big difference: He can create energy blasts, sonic beams, poisons, shoot flames, etc. and it all projects from his fat mouth! 
Blabbermouth is traitor to Mansa and now lives his life as a mercenary, waging wars for the highest bidder.
Mammal
Mammal is also a mercenary whose Keramat abilities let him shape shift into any animal. 

Shadowpuppet
A shadow manipulator. Completely pitch Black.
OneNation: Stronghold (BLM/Pride Pin-up)
PUBLISHER
 Jason Reeves is the owner of 133art, a comic book publishing imprint and printer. He is also a freelance illustrator from time to time. Jason has co-created, written, and Illustrated the award winning OneNation, Kid Carvers, and RET:CON.
This past year 133art teamed up with MV Media to produce the Changa and the Jade Obelisk comic adaptation. 133art is also 1/3 of the partnership with Nerdsoul Podcast and Legends Press, who have come together to broadcast the pop culture virtual variety show: the Rent Party.
In addition to being a comic publisher 133art, in partnership with MV Media and Hiro! Unlimited are banding together to tackle an important piece of the publishing puzzle, distribution with BIC Distro. Its focus is to get Black Indie content out to the wider audience with the help of comic retailers, bookstores, and anywhere books are sold.
For more on Jason, 133art, 133art Printing, and BIC Distro visit: 133art.com and bicdistro.com

WRITER
 Greg Anderson Elysée is a Brooklyn born Haitian-American writer, film-maker, model, and educator. He is the writer and creator of the award winning comic book/graphic novel series Is’nana the Were-Spider, a coming of age dark fantasy book about the son of Anansi the Spider, drawing inspiration from Black myths, folklore, and spirituality. He is also the creator of the sci-fi series Marassa and other works. Through various platforms, Anderson Elysée continually fights for more inclusion and better representation when it comes to people of color and sexualities.

LINE ARTIST
 Antonello Cosentino. Living in Termini Imerese, Italy, Antonello Cosentino is a member of Ehm Autoproduzione. Aside from his work with Mad Cave Studios, he has also completed work for Edizione Inkiostro, and Leviathan Labs. He was also won several awards such as the 2018 Audaci Award for best webcomic and the 2019 Andrea Pazienza award for best scripting.


COLOR ARTIST
  Carlos Lopez is a Brazilian born artist and colorist with extensive experience in the comic book industry. Since 2008 he has worked for several publishers, the latest of which is Marvel Comics on titles like Old man Logan, Amazing Spider-Man and X-men.


LETTER ARTIST
 Loris Ravina is a cartoonist born in Turin (Italy) in 1994. After studying art at the International School of Comics, he collaborated with various projects as a freelance.  He has worked as a colorist on "Kersos" #4 by Wilder Online.  In 2018 he started his collaboration with Robert Jeffrey II as colorist and letterist ("Mine To Avenge", "Harpies Origins: Aradia"), and with Enanimation as characters & props designer for the animation "Berry Bees".  In 2019 he began working with 133art - still as colorist and letterist - in the production of "RET:CON", "Changa And The Jade Obelisk" and "Woman Of The Woods".
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Funds from the campaign will go to the first print run of OneNation: Stronghold issue #1, additional payments to the creators, shipping, and to the creation of later issues of the comic series. We tried our best to keep shipping reasonable but in accordance with current rates.

The comic is already most of the way complete with line art, colors, and letters being worked on simultaneously. 133art Printing will handle all the printing and we have a great track record along these lines, while we don't foresee any difficulties in fulfillment, we have experience in providing customer service in those areas. We plan on providing weekly updates for backers after funding and will keep everyone in the loop should there be any delays.

Have a question or a concern? We would love to hear from you. You can email us at 133artpublishing@gmail.com or connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram: @133art

Thanks for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Show some love to Joystick Angels!
updates.update_content:
My guys at Rae Comics are unleashing another banger and I wanted to give you guys a heads up!
Running on KS right now is: Joystick Angels!
Here's the copy:
Joystick Angels is a comic book space opera that takes place post-Earth after an evil alien parasitic empire, the Eukarya, destroy the planet. The last of humanity settled on the satellite space vessel, The Libor Space Station, and now must defeat the alien menace. The story follows a squadron of five teenage space pilots, Fox, Deuce, Tank, Dragonetti, and Legz, called the Angels as they seek retribution.

Hi guys! Thanks for your patience, I'm happy to announce that all rewards are shipped and on their way to their destinations. If there are any questions or concerns feel free to drop a message here on Kickstarter or email us. And to everyone that hasn't fill out their surveys there is still time to do so, I'll be checking back periodically to see if there are new entries.

campaign.story:
This campaign is funding the fourth issue of OKEMUS, an ongoing mini-series written, drawn and published by T.J. Sterling of RAE Comics, colored by Balram Banerjee, and lettered by Deron Bennett of Andworld Design. This will be a full color, 32-page comic book with some very cool Variant Covers!
The purpose of campaign and our mission is to help put this entertaining and unique flagship comic series Okemus into the hands of people all over the world and continue to celebrate positive and uplifting black stories in comics.
It is also our prime mission to bring many more of our creative projects to life with the help of the Kickstarter community and more.
Alternate Cover Wraparound art for OKEMUS issue 4
OKEMUS is a sci-fi manga sentai-esk action epic about a young man named Cale who unknowingly possesses a latent super-human ability that could potentially save the human race. Enter the Okemus Hunters four villainous bio-mechanical warriors who have traveled from a dark desolate future to our modern day time period to acquire this ability and use for there own evil purposes. 
As the Hunters get closer to Cale this latent super-human ability begins to AWAKEN. 
Unbeknownst to this young man is the path that awaits him where the key to the salvation of two worlds could solely lean on his shoulders! 
Issue 4 of this 6 part comic series (offered in this Kickstarter) is 32 pages. Also available is Issue 0, 1, 2, 3. Get the whole story so far!
Cale & The Okemus Hunters
I created OKEMUS for ALL the fans of big budget action, time travel and sci-fi stories. Although OKEMUS is safe and fun for all ages we suggest readers that are 10 and up read this story due to the high powered action and fight scenes. (No different than Dragon Ball Z, Power Rangers and or Xmen).
Similar to Dragon Ball Z, Super Sentai and X-men, Okemus plays with various archetypes, themes, concepts of spirituality and non-linear storytelling to craft an epic tale that has very unique characters and situations. 
But if you dig deeper, all these elements speak to a much deeper meaning...within all of us there is greatness and it's up to us to explore that greatness fully and live our dreams.  
Page 2 from Okemus Issue #4
Issue Four of OKEMUS is 100% drawn and inked, and colored. Lettering is taking place as this campaign is running. Here are some samples of the amazing work by CEO and Artist TJ Sterling and colorist Balram Banerjee. 
Page 8 from OKEMUS issue #4
Page 11 from OKEMUS issue #4
Page 12 from OKEMUS issue #4
Earth. 2000 years in the future. 80 percent of the worlds resources have been diminished.  Animal life ceases to exist. Radiation and extreme forces of nature make the surface inhabitable for extended periods of time. War has taken it's toll. To make matters worse the world has become overrun with bio-mechanical monsters called Mechai. The Human race struggles to survive as their numbers dwindle day by day.
At one point in History there was a lone warrior who stood against the Mechai and kept them at bay, giving humanity a fighting chance. After the mysterious disappearance of this lone warrior the world was left without a protector. 
The Okemus Hunters - Mesar, Tisena, Sahta, Bain
In an attempt to recreate their missing hero a rogue science division genetically experiments on four military operatives giving them extraordinary abilities. These four warriors would become known as the Okemus Hunters. Their mission is to annihilate the Mechai by traveling through time and stopping them before they even began and finding the source of the genetic anomaly.
Rewind to the year 2015. After the four Hunters arrive in the past and begin their mission they stumble upon what they seem to be looking for. A young man genetics student at Purdue University named Cale. Drama, action, twists and turns ensue. How can one normal young man be at the center of all this fantastical story?! 
Cale: Meet your Destiny
Grab ALL Five issues to find out! One things for sure OKEMUS keeps you guessing, thinking and entertained from start to finish.   
 Sneak Peak of our 8-bit Video Game Test!  
PLAY

Company Mission Statement:
RAE Comics was created for the sole purpose of publishing unique stories about under-represented characters as well as to create innovative, cool and completely different narratives about Black, POC and Diverse heroes.  
TJ Sterling - Owner, Writer and Lead Artist of RAE Comics
TJ Sterling is the creator, writer and artist of the OKEMUS series. He has created artwork for Marvel, Dark Horse, Aspen, and recently DC Comics.
Krishna and Balram Banerjee aka The Xong Bros - Interior Colors and Alternate Cover
The Xong Bros are prolific illustrators and color artists of comics, graphic novels, character design and animation.
Deron Bennett - Andworld Design
Deron Bennett is the owner and lead Letterer for Andworld Design a company that specializes in Lettering and Graphic Design for comics. He has worked for Marvel, DC, Images and many more!
Tavvon Reynolds - RAE Comics Exclusive Toy Designer
Tavvon Reynolds, a.k.a. The 3D Hero is a 3D artist and toy designer specializing in Sculpting, Painting both traditional and digital. All toys are hand-sculpted and custom painted.
Sonia Harris - Logo Designer for RAE Comics
Conceived in New York, born in London and living in Los Angeles, Sonia Harris has been designing logos, books (including prose, art, and comic books), websites, posters, infographics, flyers, and advertising campaigns since 1998. She brings her talent to RAE Comics as it's lead Logo artist.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While there are risks and challenges involved with any Kickstarter campaign, OKEMUS runs very little risk of hitting any problems. The art is COMPLETE, and the budget has been calculated to cover all costs, including shipping. Although this is our very first campaign RAE Comics is and has been a pillar of professionalism within the comics industry since 2015. Our customers, fans and friends love us and we love them! We expect that once the campaign closes rewards will be sent out on time or ahead of schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What is THE HATED?
Equal parts spaghetti western and blaxploitation thriller, THE HATED is a new comic book written by David F. Walker, drawn by Sean Damien Hill, colored by Mx. Struble, lettered by Becca Carey, and published by Solid Comix.
THE HATED cover art by Sean Damien Hill with colors by Mx. Struble
It is 1872, and the war between the North and South is over. Neither side won. After years of bloody conflict, both sides entered into a truce, resulting in the formation of two nations, the Union States of America, where blacks are free, and the Confederate States of America, where blacks are still enslaved. Araminta Free is a former slave turned bounty hunter. She specializes in crossing the border into the Confederacy, and liberating slaves. She also tracks down Confederate war criminals, which has made her a woman with a price on her head in the southern nation. When a group of Confederate Raiders illegally ventures deep into the Union to kidnap free blacks and sell them into slavery, the stage is set for a deadly showdown between Araminta and the men who want her dead.
Imagine if director Sergio Corbucci (DJANGO, THE GREAT SILENCE) made a western starring Pam Grier as a badass, gun-slinging bounty hunter. Now imagine the story takes place in a world where the Civil War ended differently – instead of a victory for the North, there is a truce, and what had been one country is now two. This is THE HATED.
The first issue of THE HATED is 100% drawn and inked, and is currently being colored. Here are some samples of the amazing work by artist Sean Damien Hill and colorist Mx. Struble.
WHAT ARE YOU FUNDING?
This campaign is funding the first issue of THE HATED, a mini-series written and published by David F. Walker, drawn by Sean Damien Hill, colored by Shaun Struble, and lettered by Becca Carey. This will be a full color, 40-page comic book plus cover.
30 pages of story
10  back-up pages
Standard sized comic
The purpose of this campaign is to fund the production and printing of THE HATED #1, fulfill all backer rewards, and cover the cost of shipping and handling for all reward tiers. Because THE HATED is more pages than ONE FALL, the cost of printing and shipping is more, for that reason, we have set our goal higher this time. But all of the money is going towards the costs of producing and delivering all rewards, any remaining/extra funds will go toward the production of THE HATED #2.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
We wanted the freedom to create a series on our own terms, and at a pace that works for our schedules. The first issue of THE HATED is drawn, inked, and partially colored and lettered. By the time this campaign is over, the first issue will be 100% complete and ready to go to print. The money raised from this campaign will go to fund printing and productions costs of the first issue of THE HATED, production of other rewards, and shipping. Any money raised over the target goal will be used as seed money for the second issue of THE HATED.

THE HATED #1 - We've got some great rewards for this campaign, starting the the comic itself. You will have a choice of a digital comic or a physical copy. There are multiple options for covers of the physical copy, including the main Cover, and the variant Cover B (image only, no text). 
THE HATED #1 - David Mack Variant Cover - since a picture is worth 1,000 words, we'll just show it to you...
David Mack variant cover
THE HATED #1 Black and White Limited Edition - Solid Comix is pleased to offer a limited edition, black and white version of THE HATED #1. This is the exact same comic as the color edition, only without the color. This edition will have a limited print run for Kickstarter. There will be no second printing. The black and white edition will only be available here on Kickstarter (and at conventions if any are left) -- no digital copies, not available online, and no retailer copies. Once these are gone, they are gone. 
pages from the Black and White Limited Edition
 KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!!! This amazing sticker (2"x3") featuring Araminta Free is included with all physical copies. Not available anywhere else, this is special thanks to everyone supporting Solid Comix and THE HATED. 
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!!!
BadAzz MoFo's Book of SPAGHETTI WESTERNS by David F. Walker - every order of THE HATED comes with this FREE digital of David F. Walker's book about spaghetti westerns, reprinted from the pages of his 'zine BadAzz MoFo. This digital book features reviews of more than 40 films and a historic overview of the Eurowestern genre -- 114 pages, including reviews of DJANGO, THE GREAT SILENCE, A BULLET FOR THE GENERAL, and many more. This is special thanks to everyone supporting Solid Comix and THE HATED.
ADD-ONS
The Joelle Jones 8.5”x11” pin-up is now available as an add-on to all print copy reward tiers for $10 each (sorry, not available with digital only). This was supposed to be the $20k stretch goal...but since we likely won't hit that goal, and since this is such an amazing work or art, and because I appreciated all the support everyone has shown to this campaign, it is being made available. 
To add the pin-up to your existing reward tier click the “Manage your pledge” button (it should be on the right side of your screen). This will take to a page called “Change Your Pledge.” Change the “PLEDGE AMOUNT” to reflect the adding of the pin-up or any other add-ons. EXAMPLE: If you pledge $8 to get a print copy of Cover A and you want to add the Joelle Jones, you would add $10, making your new pledge amount $28.
Joelle Jones 8.5"x11" pin-up
MORE ADD-ONS
ANOTHER NEW TIER!!!
We’ve just added a very special reward tier. Let’s call it the “I Love Indie Comics” tier. This is a special bundle that includes The Hated #1 (Cover A) along with three indies titles that I really like – Harriett Tubman: Demon Slayer #1, Crescent City Monsters#1, and Is’Nana the Were-Spider: The Ballads of Rawhead & John Henry.  All three are comic projects they I have backed on Kickstarter, and I want to share them with a select group of backers. You get physical copies of all four of these comics for $20, as well as the Kickstarter Exclusive Stickers and a PDF of BadAzz MoFo’s Book of Spaghetti Westerns. Limited to only 10!!!
 NEW TIERS ADDED!!! (UPDATE - All gone!!!)
I’m very happy to announce two new reward tiers. I have a limited number of BITTER ROOT #6 variant covers – both the ‘Do the Right Thing’ tribute cover and the ‘My Neighbor Totoro’ tribute cover. Both are extremely rare, and going for upwards of $100 on eBay. I have eight copies of each cover, and once they are gone, they are gone. This reward tier includes ONE copy of BITTER ROOT #6 (either the ‘Do the Right Thing’ cover or the ‘Totoro’ cover), a printed copy of THE HATED #1 (Cover A), Kickstarter Exclusive Sticker, and Free PDF of BadAzz MoFo’s Book of SPAGHETTI WESTERNS.
SORRY...All of these rewards are gone.
$20k Stretch Goal -- Joelle Jones 8.5"x11" pin-up, colored by Mx. Struble. 
This pin-up will be available as an add-on with print copies of THE HATED #1





THE CREATORS
David F. Walker - writer/publisher
 DAVID F. WALKER is the co-creator of BITTER ROOT (Image) NAOMI (DC) and  author of THE LIFE OD FREDERICK DOUGLASS (Ten Speed). He has written for Marvel, Dark Horse, BOOM!, and Dynamite.
Sean Damien Hill - artist
 SEAN DAMIEN HILL is an illustrator of comics, graphic novels, who also dabbles in the realm of concept art, character design and graphic design.
Mx. Struble - colorist
MX. STRUBLE is a writer and colorist working out of Dallas. In their free time, they like to make musi
Becca Carey - letterer/designer
 BECCA CAREY is a designer and illustrator with a penchant for the handmade approach.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While there are risks and challenges involved with any Kickstarter campaign, THE HATED runs very little risk of hitting any problems. The art is complete, and the budget has been calculated to cover all costs, including shipping. Our first campaign for ONE FALL was successful, it came in on budget, and rewards were sent ahead of schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I've heard from some of you that your rewards never showed up. Replacements are going out in the mail this week. Now, if I may vent for a moment...
As many of you know, the United States Post Office has been facing difficult times, due in no small part to efforts to dismantle that agency. At the risk of getting too political, the damage wrought on the USPS by the Trump administration has been mind-boggling. I have been using the post office as my main source of business shipping for more than 25 years. In that time, I've had more problems in the last six months than in all those years combined. There have been more copies of The Hated that have simply disappeared than anything else I've ever shipped. In most cases, tracking shows that these packages were delivered, even though they weren't. And only a small handful have been returned. Who knows what happened to all of them?

updates.update_userinfo: Last Call for Reward Surveys in 2020!!!
updates.update_content:
There are still a few of you that have not filled out reward surveys, as well as a few of you who just filled it out within the last few weeks. Backers who recently filled out the survey, your rewards will be shipping within the upcoming week.
The deadline for filling out a reward survey AND getting your rewards shipped to you in 2020 is Monday, November 30, 2020. I will still ship rewards in 2021, but not until after the new year.
As of now, ALL rewards have been shipped that can be shipped. What does that mean? Well...if you have not received your rewards, it is either because you haven't filled out a reward survey OR your package was lost in the mail. Please contact me via direct message if you have not received your rewards.

UPDATE: Okay...I've checked the status on every reward package that has been sent out. Of the 900+ packages that have been sent out to folks in the United States, there are exactly 15 that have not been delivered. Some were sent Priority, some were sent Media Mail, and according to the Unites States Postal Service, all are still in transit...though all are delayed for reasons unknown. I'm preparing to send out new packages to the 15 of you still waiting. My only hesitation is that I suspect the new packages will take as long as the initial packages. That said, if a reward package isn't delivered this week, I'll start sending replacements over the weekend. I'm sorry this has taken so long.

I know some of you are frustrated that your rewards have not arrived yet. Trust me, I'm frustrated too. Without getting into politics (or political conspiracies), the United States Postal Service is a mess at the moment. Just do a Google search of "USPS delays" and you'll see what's going on. At the moment, there are about 20 packages that have not been delivered in the United States, which is down from more than 30 last week -- so they are getting delivered. Foreign deliveries have started arriving, primarily in Canada (which is surprising). For those of you waiting on your rewards, please, be patient. I am checking the tracking every day.

updates.update_userinfo: THE HATED #1 is now available to everyone!!!
updates.update_content:
We now have a store where you can buy both physical copies and PDF copies of THE HATED!!!
https://gumroad.com/solidcomix

Several people have reached out to inquire about their rewards. All rewards have been shipped to backers who provided their mailing address before July 23rd. If you provided your address after the 23rd, it has not yet shipped. Here is what I can tell you about orders that HAVE NOT ARRIVED...
Between July 10th and 12th, I shipped over 300 reward packages. Approximately 40 of those have not been delivered yet. I've checked the tracking, and most appear to have been delayed at mail processing facilities in either Portland or Seattle. All are currently "in transit." If you live in the United States and still have NOT received your rewards by the end of this week, please email me directly.

Hey folks, everyone outside of the United States waiting for me to come up with a creative way to handle the unexpectedly high cost of shipping, I've come up with the solution...I paid the postage rates (it's only money). Honestly, I could've flown to Europe, and hand-delivered comics for about the same money. I was actually supposed to do a book tour in France this summer, and I could've made trips to several other countries to deliver comics in person...but the damn pandemic ruined everything!!!
Speaking of the pandemic...I hope you all are doing your best to stay safe and healthy.

updates.update_userinfo: Attention Backers OUTSIDE of the United States!!! (and Damaged Copies!!!)
updates.update_content:
If you are a backer outside of the United States, I have sent you a private email to the address you provided. If you don't see it in your inbox, please check your spam folders.
The problem I am currently having is related to shipping costs. The cost of shipping two comics plus pin-ups and stickers to most countries in Europe is $11.26. The cost of shipping three comics plus pin-ups and stickers is $24.40, and the cost of shipping four comics is even more. The cost difference has to do with weight restrictions. I am working on a solution, and will have this all figured out in a few days. Thank you for your patience.

updates.update_userinfo: Missing Rewards & Damaged Copies & Foreign Orders
updates.update_content:
MISSING REWARDS - Hey everyone, now is the time that rewards should be showing up. I've checked the tracking numbers on a bunch of packages, and some have yet to be delivered. If you are in the U.S. and your reward package has not shown up by July 23rd, send me a message.
DAMAGED COPIES - If your rewards were severely damaged in the mail, please let me know, and I can replace it*. It has come to my attention that some copies of the comic that shipped were damaged prior to being sent (this was something that occurred at the printer). I will replace these as well. Just message me.

If you are a backer who lives outside the United States, I wanted to share this update. Because of COVID-19, the United States Postal Service has implemented various new policies for mail leaving the U.S. It is my understanding that USPS is no longer taking paper customs forms, but the website is for electronic forms is inaccessible. All of this is to say that there will be a delay in shipping foreign orders. I hope to have everything resolved within the next few days. Thanks for your patience.

campaign.story:
HISTORY IS HORROR!!!
This Black History Month Rosarium Publishing cordially invites you to see our history like you never have before.
From Box of Bones #2
FROM THE MINDS OF AYIZE JAMA-EVERETT 
AND JOHN JENNINGS!!!
When Black graduate student, Lyndsey, begins her dissertation work on a mysterious box that pops up during the most violent and troubled time in Africana history, she has no idea that her research will lead her on a phantasmagorical journey from West Philadelphia riots to Haitian slave uprisings. Wherever Lyndsey finds someone who has seen the Box, chaos ensues. Soon, even her own sanity falls into question. In the end, Lyndsey will have to decide if she really wants to see what’s inside the Box of Bones.
Described as “Tales from the Crypt Meets Black History,” Box of Bones is a supernatural nightmare tour through some of the most violent and horrific episodes in the African Diaspora.
Volume 1 contains art from John Jennings, Sole Rebel, Damian Duffy, Frances Olivia Liddell-Rodriguez, Tommy Nguyen, Jarmel and Jamal Williams, and Bryan Christopher Moss with covers by Stacey Robinson!!!
Help us raise $10,000 to bring this book to print.
By Anthony Moncada

THE CREATORS
Ayize Jama-Everett
Ayize Jama-Everett was born in 1974 and raised in Harlem, New York. Since then he has traveled extensively in Northern Africa, New Hampshire, and Northern California. He holds a Master’s in Clinical Psychology and a Master’s in Divinity. He is the author of three novels, The Liminal People, The Liminal War, and The Entropy of Bones.

"When John Jennings first brought the idea to me years ago, I never imagined it would involve so many other creatives that I’d admired from afar. It’s been amazing to collaborate with some of the most talented up and coming and established artists. The fact that we’re organizing around what’s basically a bad fever dream of my historically obsessed black brain is a bit humbling, but I think the narrative and our process gives everyone a chance to shine. My hope is that this work is transformative to the industry, showing creatives and publishers that narratives around black people in the US are as diverse and marketable as any other stories. I’m proud to be a part of this and excited for what happens in the future of the Box of Bones."
Box of Bones #1 -- Cover by Stacey Robinson
John Jennings
John Jennings is a Professor of Media and Cultural Studies at the University of California at Riverside. His creative and academic work centers around intersectional narratives regarding identity politics and popular media. Jennings is co-editor of the Eisner Award-winning collection The Blacker the Ink: Constructions of Black Identity in Comics and Sequential Art and co-founder/organizer of The Schomburg Center’s Black Comic Book Festival in Harlem. He is co-founder and organizer of the MLK NorCal’s Black Comix Arts Festival in San Francisco and also SOL-CON: The Brown and Black Comix Expo at the Ohio State University. Together with Damian Duffy, he worked on the New York Times Best Selling Kindred: A Graphic Novel Adaptation (for which he won his second Eisner) and Parable of the Sower: A Graphic Novel Adaptation. His debut solo effort, the hoodoo noir Blue Hand Mojo: Hard Times Road, and Pitch Black Rainbow: The Art of John Jennings are his other Rosarium projects. He was recently tagged to direct and curate a new imprint for Abrams, Megascope.

"We created Box of Bones because we wanted to figure out a creative way to talk about black history and teach people about the injustices that black folk have had to endure. We were thinking about the Movement for Black Lives and our current political climate and how violence against people of color has been both normalized and erased. Box of Bones is way to talk about that erasure and present a narrative that embraces a righteous rage about black pain but also talk about what happens when you let yourself indulge in that rage too much."
From Box of Bones #3 -- Art by Bryan Christopher Moss

Hey, Everybody--
I hope 2021 is treating you well and that things are finally looking up.
I'm catching up on some late fulfillments. Many of you have yet to fill out your surveys. If you haven't received your order yet, it's because you haven't done so. Please fill out your survey as soon as possible, so we can get your books to you. I really appreciate it.

updates.update_userinfo: The Day the Klan Came to Town
updates.update_content:
Hey, Everybody--
Hope all is well in your world. I just wanted to tell you about another KS campaign, THE DAY THE KLAN CAME TO TOWN. It's a graphic novel I wrote about a Klan riot that happened in my hometown (Carnegie, PA) back in 1923.
We've already hit our initial goal. We're now trying to reach $10K. We could really use your help. Please feel free to check it out:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ww3/the-day-the-klan-came-to-town?ref=nav_search&result=project&term=the%20day%20the%20klan%20came%20to%20town

RUINING CHRISTMAS
Hey, Party People---

Our good friends at Stranger Comics, known for their heroic Elven series, Niobe, have some new "heroic" Elves in comics… in a hilarious and cheeky comedy caper: RUINING CHRISTMAS. Yeah, this ain’t for kids! It’s an irreverent tale about the spirit of giving taking it… for far too long... We could all use a laugh right now! Oh yeah, and Seb says you have to read it with a British gangster accent.

Hi, Everybody--
I have GREAT news! My printer tells me that they will be shipping the books from Toronto on the 22nd. That means I'll be getting them either around Christmas Eve or Boxing Day. I'll be shipping them off as soon as I get them, so you'll be getting them around New Year's Day.
Thanks as always for your support and patience. We couldn't do any of this without you. Take care and enjoy your holiday season.

Hi, Everybody--

Sorry it's been so long. This year, as you know, has been quite the rollercoaster ride. Yes, we've had a few setbacks. However, things are back on track. We're in the final stages of the editing process and should be sending BOX OF BONES off to the printer in the next 2 or 3 weeks. There will be some other good news later as there are some pretty cool things going on with BoB in particular and Rosarium in general.

updates.update_content:
Greetings, Everyone--
I apologize for the delay. Things, as you may assume, have been fairly topsy turvy these past couple months. Chasing around a quarantined 3-year-old is a helluva lot more challenging than I would've ever expected. However, we are safe and sound and grateful that our family and friends are also the same.
I sincerely hope that you, too, are safe and have figured out a way to navigate the craziness of the outside world.

Hi, Everybody--
As you know, we made our goal a few days ago. There are about 12 hours left and we're inching up on $12,000. I'm really excited about this and this project. Thanks as always for your support. If you don't know, I really love book covers. I've been sitting on a bunch of these for awhile, but I wanted to share with you the covers of what's coming your way from Rosarium in the next year. I really do hope you enjoy them.

Hey, Party People--
Only 4 days to go. We've made it! Thanks for your support. I wanted to share this interview that Ayize did with Smash Pages. Hope you enjoy. And please feel free to signal boost, if you like. :)
http://smashpages.net/2020/03/05/smash-pages-qa-ayize-jama-everett/

campaign.story:
MVmedia, LLC and 133art have joined forces to publish Changa and the Jade Obelisk, a graphic novel based on the amazing Sword and Soul book series by Milton Davis. We chose to do this project because of the need for more illustrated stories based on African/African Diaspora culture and traditions, and also because it's fun! For years readers have enjoyed the tales of Changa and his crew, so now we're bringing it to you fully illustrated.
Jason Reeves, owner of 133art, has assembled a talented team to bring the first story of Changa's adventures to life. Written by Robert Jeffrey, Illustrated by Matteo Illuminati with Letters and Color Art by Loris Ravina, the story of Changa and his crew's search to find the secrets of the Jade obelisk jumps to life in the pages below!
Changa and the Jade Obelisk #1 will be a 20-page, full color comic.


The Story
Changa and the Jade Obelisk is adapted from the novel Changa's Safari by Milton Davis.
           'In the 15th century on the East Coast of Africa begin the amazing exploits of merchant/adventurer Changa Diop. From the Swahili merchant cities of Mombasa, to the secretive kingdoms of Madagascar, Changa, the sorcerer Panya and the mysterious swordsman The Tuareg experience adventures beyond the imagination when they pursue the malicious Bahati, keeper of the Jade Obelisk!
The Characters
Changa
In the city of Mombasa Changa became the apprentice of one of its most successful merchants, Belay. In death, Belay bequeathed to Changa a portion of his merchant fleet. Changa has decided to use Belay's gift to amass enough wealth to raise an army, free his people from the sadistic grip of Usenge, and avenge his father’s death. Let the grand safari begin!Forced to flee his homeland of Kongo when his father, King Mfumu, was overthrown and killed by the evil sorcerer Usenge, Changa Diop has led many lives. Trained as a thief, later a warrior, dubbed Mbogo ‘The Bull’ in the fighting pits of Mogadishu, merchant, and finally mariner.

  Panya.
Panya lived a peaceful and sheltered life in Yorubaland until she discovered her betrothal to a local oba she despised. Desperate to be free of her obligation, she called on the orisha Oya for help. Oya responded in kind. Oya 'sat on her head' during a violent confrontation between her and her betrothed and Panya, possessed by Oya, took his life. Owing a debt to Oya came with drastic physical consequences, but breaking the laws of her homeland would mean her life! With that, Panya fled her home, using her skills and a healer, fighter, and daughter of Oya to survive. She eventually found her way to Mombasa, where chance brought her together with Changa.
The Tuareg
Once the scourge of the Sahara, El Sirocco fell for the charms of a sorceress who brought him to his knees and sold him into slavery. Seeing his downfall as a sign from Allah, El Sirocco, known to his captors as ‘The Tuareg,’ took a vow of silence until he could atone for his sins. His path led to the fighting pits of Mogadishu, where on the day his masters planned his death he was saved by the intervention of Mbogo ‘The Bull.’ His benefactor purchased him then freed him, but instead of returning home, he pledged his life and his sword to Mbogo, a man also known as Changa Diop.
Amir (Prince) Zakee
Amir Zakee ibn Basheer was the third and youngest son of Sultan Basheer ibn Raheem of Yemen. Though the youngest, he was the most promising and was sure to be the next ruler of the Yemeni sultanate. Zakee had proven himself in battle, marching with his father and grandfather to defeat the followers of the Red Priest. The infidels worshiped a strange artifact, a jade obelisk that emitted amazing powers. The Yemeni defeated the Red Priest and his denizens, took the jade obelisk and locked it away. As a reward for his valor, Zakee was appointed governor of Aden, the most important port of Yemen. Zakee’s rule was peaceful; the people of Aden loved him. Then one day a mysterious ship arrived in the harbor, carrying a people from a land unknown to Zakee and the others. The commander of the ship was the most beautiful woman Zakee had ever seen. When asked who she was, the woman answered. Her name was Bahati, and she was seeking an object of great value to her people. Zakee asked this woman who had captured his heart what she sought. A jade obelisk, she replied.
Bahati
Thousands of seasons ago, a war raged between the Ancestors and the Sorcerers. In a bid to defeat the ancestors' greatest champion, the sorcerers created the great and terrible Bahati. Her emergence into the the war proved to briefly turn the tide, but eventually the ancestors prevailed crushing the Sorcerers. Punished for their insurrection, Bahati was dispersed into the ether and the power of the Sorcerers was divided and contained in twelve talisman, which were scattered throughout the world. However, the Ancestors made a mistake, Bahati had been diminished, but she had not been destroyed. She reincorporated herself then set out to find all the talisman in hopes of regaining the power of the sorcerers and to destroy the ancestors once and for all.
The Creators
Creator/Writer
Milton Davis
Milton Davis is an award winning Black Fantastic writer and owner of MVmedia, LLC, a publishing company specializing in Science Fiction, Fantasy and Sword and Soul. Milton is the author of twenty-three novels and editor/co-editor of seven anthologies. Milton’s work had also been featured in Black Power: The Superhero Anthology; Skelos 2: The Journal of Weird Fiction and Dark Fantasy Volume 2, Steampunk Writes Around the World published by Luna Press and Bass Reeves Frontier Marshal Volume Two. Milton’s story ‘The Swarm’ was nominated for the 2018 British Science Fiction Association Award for Short Fiction. His screenplay, Ngolo, won the 2014 Urban Action Showcase Award for Best Screenplay.
Art Director
133art
The award winning studio 133art is a Los Angeles based comic book imprint founded by illustrator Jason Reeves. The studio is comprised of a small group of freelance professionals; including illustrator Jason Reeves, writer Alverne Ball, & colorist Luis Guerrero. The three are collaborators on several of 133art's comics and properties; the Glyph Award winning 'OneNation', 'RET:CON' and all-ages comic 'Kid Carvers'. Although primarily a comic book production studio, 133art offers services in comic book printing as well through the other wing of the company: 133art Printing. For more on 133art visit: 133art.com
Writer
Robert Jeffrey II
Robert Jeffrey II: A freelance writer with over 13 years of experience, Robert was chosen along with 5 other writers (out of more than a thousand applicants,) to take part in the 2017 DC Comics Writers Workshop. He’s the creator/ writer of the Glyph Award winning comic book series Route 3, Editor In Chief of BlackSci-Fi.com, has contributed to such anthologies like Dark Universe: Bright Empire, and is co-writer of the Glyph Award nominated Radio Free Amerika. His client work includes work done for the Centers for Disease Control and Nitto Tires, and he currently co-hosts A Light In The Sky: A 4400 Recap. He is the lead writer on 133 ARTS's upcoming series, RET:CON. Jeffrey was also recently chosen to appear inDC Comics' NEW TALENT SHOWCASE w/ a story for John Stewart/ Green Lantern.
Illustrator
Matteo Illuminati
Matteo Illuminati is a comic book artist and illustrator  from Rome,Italy.He has worked  on Manfont Yamazaki 18 years, Apocrypha vol.1, Wilder Online Kersos #4, Segni d’Autore Space Anabasis vol.4,  Evoluzione Publishing Mine To Avenge #1-2-3 and Aradia #1.You can follow Matteo Illuminati on all his social sites.
Color Artist
Loris Ravina
Loris Ravina is a cartoonist born in Turin (Italy) in 1994. After studying art at the International School of Comics, he collaborated with various projects as a freelance.  He has worked as a colorist on "Kersos" #4 by Wilder Online.  In 2018 he started his collaboration with Evoluzione Publishing as colorist and letterist ("Mine To Avenge", "Harpies Origins: Aradia"), and with Enanimation as characters & props designer for the animation "Berry Bees".  In 2019 he began working with 133art - still as colorist and letterist - in the production of "RET:CON", "Changa And The Jade Obelisk" and "Woman Of The Woods".
The Rewards!

About us
For eleven years MVmedia has published over 30 books focusing on science fiction and fantasy based on Africa/African diaspora culture and tradition. Our books are sold worldwide, and many of our groundbreaking anthologies have been taught in universities and colleges throughout the United States. MVmedia's ultimate goal is to offer its titles in variouia media formats, and Changa and the Jade Obelisk is an example.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Funds from the campaign will go to the first print run of Changa and the Jade Obelisk issue #1, additional payments to the creators, shipping, and to the creation of later issues of the comic series.
We tried our best to keep shipping reasonable, especially for international orders.
The comic is already halfway complete with line art, colors, being worked on simultaneously. 133art Printing will handle all the printing and will co-distribute along side MV Media. Both companies have a great track record along these lines, and while we don't foresee any difficulties in fulfillment, we have experience in providing customer service in those areas.
We plan on providing weekly updates for backers after funding and will keep everyone in the loop should there be any delays.
Have a question or a concern? We would love to hear from you. You can email us at MV Media email or Connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram: Facebook https://www.facebook.com/blackfantastic/; Instagram @obadoro; Twitter @thegriot

Thanks for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Professional wrestling is real. So are werewolves, vampires, and really greedy promoters that will stop at nothing to make a dollar.  
Jimmy “Resurrecter” King, is a third generation wrestler dealing with the curse of his family – every time he is killed in the ring, he comes back to life. As if that wasn’t bad enough, now the Resurrecter must fight not only for his life, but also for his family, as he is forced to compete in the deadly Continental Gauntlet.
ONE FALL is loaded with action, drama, dark comedy, and tons of wrestling.

One Fall #1 Mock Cover (not final)


One Fall, Page 2
One Fall, Page 3
 WHAT ARE YOU FUNDING? 
This campaign is funding the first issue of ONE FALL, a five-issue series written and published by David F. Walker and drawn by Brett Weldele. This will be a full color, 32-page comic book with 24 pages of main story, and a back-up feature by writer Ted Pirro. 
Our goal will cover the following:
Production - Comics and Art Prints
Supplies - Pages, etc. 
Shipping/Shipping Supplies
Marketing for One Fall and Solid Comix

WHY KICKSTARTER?
We wanted the freedom to create a series on our own terms, and at a pace that works for our schedules. The first issue of ONE FALL is drawn, inked, and partially colored and lettered. By the time this campaign is over, we will have the first issue 100% in the can and ready to go to print. The money raised from this campaign will go to fund printing of the first issue of ONE FALL, production of other rewards, and shipping. Any money raised over the target goal will be used to help offset the cost of creating the first issue (which we all did for free), and as seed money for the second issue. In addition, we are hoping to continue to spread the word about SOLID COMIX!
PLAY


WHO WE ARE
David F. Walker -- writer and co-creator of ONE FALL. David is co-creator of BITTER ROOT (Image) and NAOMI (DC), and has worked for Marvel (POWER MAN & IRON FIST, NIGHTHAWK, LUKE CAGE), Boom (PLANET OF THE APES: URSUS), and Dynamite (SHAFT).
Writer David F. Walker
Brett Weldele -- artist and co-creator of ONE FALL. Brett is the artist and co-creator of THE SURROGATES (Top Shelf), THE LIGHT (Image), and SOUTHLAND TALES (Graphitti). 
Artist Brett Weldele
Ted Pirro – writer and creative consultant on ONE FALL. Ted is writing all of the back-up stories for the series. 


SNEAK PEEKS FROM THE LOCKER ROOM

Brett Weldele 5.5 x 8.5 inch Art Prints
 "Bitter Root" (2nd Print) Issue #1 & "Naomi" Issue #1 

"The Army of Dr. Moreau" & "The Light"

STRETCH GOALS!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every creative projects has risks, but thankfully with One Fall we avoided the biggest risks of all by waiting until we had most of the book done. As of right now, the first issue of One Fall is completely drawn and inked, and Brett has colored almost half of the pages. We will be 100% done with One Fall #1 by the time this campaign ends, which means the first issue will be going to press no later than April. We have set the targeted release date for June 2019, though we are hoping to fulfill most rewards by May 2019.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: If you haven't received your reward yet, please take time to complete the reward survey. We need the completed surveys so we know where to send you rewards. Thanks.

Most backer rewards have been shipped. The exceptions are foreign order, retailers, and anyone who hasn't filled out a reward survey. Retailers and foreign orders will go out within the next week or so. An email has been sent with a link to the PDF of ONE FALL #1. 
As always, thanks for your support.

There was a delay at the printer, and then I was out of town for a convention, but as of right now, ONE FALL #1 is done! I'll pick up the books from the printer on Monday or Tuesday, and start processing orders later in the week.

ONE FALL #1 is ready to go to press. We're just waiting for some of you to finish your reward surveys, so that we know what name to put on the "Thank You" page (as well as where we need to send your rewards). If you haven't filled out your reward survey yet, please do so. Thanks.

Thanks to all of the backers and those of you that helped spread the word. Here's a quick update, so you know where things are... 
Brett and I are finalizing the back-up pages for ONE FALL #1. Brett is leaving for C2E2 on Thursday, March 21st. I'm leaving for Wondercon the following week. Our plan is to wrap up all the last minute production stuff by the week of April 8th, and have the first issue off to the printer shortly thereafter. We're looking to have the first wave of rewards in the mail by late April or early May.

Several retailers have reached out to me and pointed out that the RETAILERS PACKAGE Tier is a bit cost prohibitive. I'm still figuring out the magic of Kickstarter, and want to make sure that I do right by retailers. Because of the way Kickstarter is set up, I can't change the reward tier. That said, I will be making the following adjustments once the RETAILERS PACKAGE rewards ship...
- All of the RETAILERS PACKAGE level rewards will be increased from 7 copies of ONE FALL to 10 copies. This will lower your cost to $3.50 per unit.

I'm pleased to announce that Brett has finished coloring ONE FALL #1. We are right on schedule to have the book off to the printer by the end of the month, and rewards shopping by early May. Thank you to everyone who has backed this project and spread the word. We still have two weeks left -- let's keep moving forward. Thanks.

campaign.story:
About Canvas
Characters
Grandpa Arthur
Amara/Daughter
Aura/Granddaughter
CANVAS centers around a grandfather who is trying to regain his inspiration after suffering a loss.
This story is something we can all relate to. Sometimes in life things happen that make it hard for you to keep fighting for what you love. It's not so much a matter of ability, but rather a testament to the will of the human spirit. We can all find strength and creativity in the most surprising places and this story exemplifies that. 
Our Goal
Making an animated film is hard work. Everything from art to the final product takes tons of effort from talented people. We're hoping to raise at least $40,000 to get us through the production and post-production process. We have a stretch goal of $55,000 to make this the best quality film as it can possibly be. This project is extremely near and dear to our hearts and we hope you can help us bring it to life! 
Production Costs

Our Team
This project is such a collaborative effort. We've put together a team from all over the world of incredibly talented artists and each of them have brought something special to the film.

Frank Abney III - Director
Frank began working in the entertainment world over a decade ago. He's been fortunate to work in Games, TV, and Film, on a variety of projects. Most recent include: "Tomb Raider" (2013), Disney's "Frozen" and "Big Hero 6" (Academy Award winners for "Best Animated Feature"), DreamWorks Animation's "Kung Fu Panda 3", and "Boss Baby" (Academy Award Nominee for "Best Animated Feature"), Pixar's "Coco" (Academy Award winner for "Best Animated Feature"), and "Incredibles 2" (Academy Award Nominee for "Best Animated Feature").
Paige Johnstone - Producer
Paige has worked on academy award nominated films at major studios such as DreamWorks and Pixar. Paige's background in animation gives her a unique perspective on how to get things done in an efficient manner while always maintaining the creative integrity of any project she works on. 
TB Choi - Character Designer
Sojin (TB) is a freelance character designer. TB has been instrumental in creating some of the characters of Canvas, bringing masterful appeal. Her design for Mom elevated the character to a whole new level. When she's not creating gorgeous pieces of art, she's teaching drawing skills.
Randy Bishop - Character Designer
Randy is a hard working and talented character designer who has been working as a freelancer for the past several years in the animation, gaming, and publishing industries. Randy has a passion for storytelling and cherishes any opportunity to be part of a project that tells a good story. He lives in eastern Idaho with his wife and four kiddos. Randy's character design for Grandpa brought something truly special to the film. 

More Info
Website: thecanvasfilm.com
Twitter: @CanvasFilm
Instagram: @canvasfilm
Contact us: canvasfilmcontact@gmail.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of our biggest challenges is trying to plan for the unexpected. With such a large team, and such a technical process, things are always bound to creep up unexpectedly. We've done our absolute best to prepare for these things, but won't be able to do so without reaching our goal amount!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello from team Canvas! 
Thank you all for your patience during these uncertain times. Once upon a time, we had planned to release the film much earlier in the year. After shelter in place was issued, our final sound mix was pushed out indefinitely, which severely stalled our production by several months. 
We're now excited to say that we've not only finished our final sound mix, but we've finished post production as well! Thanks to all of you wonderful people who donated to make this dream come true, the film is done! We're hoping to get into a few festivals later this year and if theaters do reopen, we'll have a short theater run in Los Angeles.

Our Kickstarter is officially done! I can’t thank you all enough for the amazing support. The pledges, the sharing, the kind words... Everything! It all meant so much, and was much more than we could have anticipated.
From all of us, THANK YOU!

We did it!! A huge thank you to everyone who has contributed to make this happen. We are beyond humbled and grateful for the support and so excited to bring this project to life. We can't wait to share it with all of you!
We'll be introducing a few rewards to hit our stretch goal, but just wanted to take a moment to say thank you, thank you, thank you!! 
-Frank and Paige

Happy Saturday everyone! As of Friday 2/22 we’ve hit 50% Of our goal! Thank you for your continued support of Canvas. We are so honored that you all would take the time to see what we are wanting to put out into the world.
We’re halfway there, but still have to keep the momentum going. We ask that you continue to share the project with your family, friends, etc and tell them why you backed it. Word of mouth and the power of social media has been huge so far. Let’s keep that going!

Thank you all so much for the outstanding reception of our short film & campaign. The love is felt, and appreciated! Let’s keep this going, and continue to share. We can make this happen!
Thanks again!!
Frank E. Abney III

campaign.story:
Introductions 
Welcome to RET:CON, an Afrofuturist comic series from Glyph Award winning indie comic imprint 133art. Written by Robert Jeffrey (DC Comic Writers Workshop, DC New Talent Workshop, Route 3). Illustrated by Jordi Perez (Top Cow's Grand Theft Astro). Colored by Paris Alleyne (IDW, Boom! Studios, Lion's Forge). 
RET:CON #1 will be a 20-page full color comic.
This is 133art's first Kickstarter and we wanted to come out of the gate strong. If you know anything about our little studio, you know we strive to produce inclusive quality entertainment in the realms of Superheroes, Sci-Fi, and Fantasy. Its our goal to see faces of color as the heroes and champions of modern mythology. RET:CON is an extension of that goal, and ultimately, making comics like this is the joy of our lives.
The Story
In a time when artificial intelligence governs the remains of a world ravaged by violent temporal ruptures, the RET:CON Agency is formed to stop reality from falling into entropy. Agent '4 am' is a part of RET:CON's elite unit, the Slingshotters, who's mission is to breach the time stream to repair the future.

        The A.I. designed to analyze and direct the Slingshotters in fixing the ruptures, the RET:CON Engine, requires very unorthodox methods, alterations previously thought to result in a time catastrophe.  4am's first mission:  infiltrate the Wolfsschanze and Kill Hitler!
 The Characters 
Agent 4am
Agent 4am is the consummate soldier. Astute, aggressive, allegiant, and best of all compliant. 4am believes in the RET:CON agency's mission and will do anything, remove any obstacle, to see it through. He can see no flaw in the system... but what if that's the problem? 
Pandora
While the RET:CON Engine keeps a watchful eye on the time stream, Pandora is the woman in charge of the Slingshotter's well being.
  Once a soldier herself, Pandora has risen through the ranks of the agency to become its lead physician. Her specialty is in time travel psychology, specifically treating its effects on the human brain. While the physical toll on Slingshotters is high, she finds that managing the mental effects of rigorous temporal transit is even more treacherous. Pandora has made it her mission to solve these issues to keep her soldiers physically safe and mentally healthy. 
Agent Noon
Don't let Agent Noon's aloof vibes and eclectic style fool you, she is one of most capable agents to come out of the RET:CON agency. She is the perfect time agent with extensive knowledge and expertise in temporal warfare. She's a formidable pilot, certified in a wide array of weapons and time tech, stealth extraction, subterfuge and infiltration. Dedicated and fiercely loyal to her cause, Noon will do anything to save our future. 
Midnight
As the battle to save space and time continues, Midnight stands at its center as the biggest unknown quantity. Is he an ally? Or is this man another obstacle in the organization's goal of saving our future? 
Slingsuit
The Slingsuit is designed to push and pull, or 'slingshot' the RET:CON Agents through the time stream. The suit protects the wearer from the potential harmful energies of time travel, also the under armor provides upgraded physical strength and protection.
 Aashini Anika Khatri 
The first time travel pioneer or 'Slingshotter'; was an Indian woman: Airman Aashini Anika Khatri. 
The Creators
Publisher/Creator
Jason Reeves. New Orleans, La. native Jason Reeves is a publisher, art director & award winning illustrator operating out of Los Angeles, CA. His most recent works are Creator, Publisher & Illustrator of the OneNation series by 133art Publishing. Past projects include Featured Illustrator in Black Comix Returns by Magnetic Press/Lion Forge; A hardcover collection of art & essays showcasing the best African American artists in today's vibrant comic book culture.  Writer & Illustrator on Arch Enemy/USAToday.com's F-00 Fighters webcomic.

            In addition to comics, he has done illustration for Esquire Magazine, the USA Network, Wizards of the Coast,  Heavy Metal, & HASBRO. 
Writer
Robert Jeffrey II: A freelance writer with over 13 years of experience, Robert was chosen along with 5 other writers (out of more than a thousand applicants,) to take part in the 2017 DC Comics Writers Workshop. He’s the creator/ writer of the Glyph Award winning comic book series Route 3, Editor In Chief of BlackSci-Fi.com, has contributed to such anthologies like Dark Universe: Bright Empire, and is co-writer of the Glyph Award nominated Radio Free Amerika. His client work includes work done for the Centers for Disease Control and Nitto Tires, and he currently co-hosts A Light In The Sky: A 4400 Recap. He is the lead writer on 133 ARTS's upcoming series, RET:CON. Jeffrey was also recently chosen to appear inDC Comics' NEW TALENT SHOWCASE w/ a story for John Stewart/ Green Lantern.
Illustrator
Jordi Perez is an amazing illustrator operating out of Orense, Spain. He's currently working as illustrator on Top Cow Productions new Sci-Fi comic Grand Theft Astro.
Colorist
Paris Alleyne is a Toronto based illustrator and colorist. He's worked with IDW and Boom! and has his work featured in Lion Forge's Black Comix Returns artbook. In 2016, he worked with Chapterhouse publishing doing colors on the first volume of Captain Canuck as part of the company's revival of the classic, Canadian character. Chapterhouse later in 2017, became the home for his own creator-owned series Haven, written by Kevin Parnell. He's done colors and illustrations for a number of independent comics including a short, Aurora Award nominated stint on Joe Books' Rift World Chronicles.
Cover Artist
 Sean Damien Hill is a comic artist from Washington DC who’s most known for the Glyph Award winning series Route 3 from Terminus Media. Sean has worked on a variety of comics such as Grimm Tales of Terror, Dark Shaman, the upcoming Space Pussy Cat, and Solid Comix THE HATED. 

The Rewards
We wanted to keep it simple with these, at the same time, we think there's a few cool surprises you can only get from this campaign.
 Add-ons
 Add-ons are a way for you to customize your pledge to get exactly what you desire by selecting from a list of additional items.  There may be no single pledge level to get all the items you desire, but with Add-ons you can get what you are looking for.
 The first thing you do is look at the additional items and determine the cost associated with products that are not provided in your pledge level rewards.  If you would like to change your pledge, just click the 'manage your pledge' button, which should have replaced the 'back this project' button at the top of your page. Then, you increase your pledge by that additional amount. 
When our Kickstarter campaign is over, you will be asked to fill out a survey so we have your correct address and you will be able to alert us to the extra items included in your pledge. 
 A Little About Us
The award winning studio 133art is a Los Angeles based comic book imprint founded by illustrator Jason Reeves. The studio is comprised of a small group of freelance professionals including illustrator Jason Reeves, writer Alverne Ball, & colorist Luis Guerrero. The three are collaborators on several of 133art's comics and properties: the Glyph Award winning 'OneNation', 'F-00 Fighters' and all-ages comic 'Kid Carvers'. Although primarily a comic book production studio, 133art offers services in comic book printing as well through the other wing of the company: 133art Printing. For more visit: 133art.com
133art on NERDSoul!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and Challenges
Funds from the campaign will go to the first print run of the comic book, additional payments to the creators, shipping, and to the creation of later issues of the RET:CON series.

We tried our best to keep shipping reasonable, especially for international orders. 

The comic is already complete up to the lettering, which is halfway finished. 133art prints and distributes all our own products and provide print-on-demand/shipping services in cooperation with Peepgame Comix regularly. This is why we are able to offer such a quick turnaround on the pledges (except for the 1/6 scale custom figure which will take a bit longer to paint and the fan feature RET:CON back-up story which needs to be written, illustrated, lettered, and colored). So while we don't foresee any difficulties in fulfillment, we have experience in providing customer service in those areas.
 
We plan on having weekly updates for backers after funding and will keep everyone in the loop should there be any delays.

 Have a question or a concern? We would love to hear from you. You can email us at 133artpublishing@gmail.com or Connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram (@133art)

Thanks for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The  history  books  call  it  a  house  of  horrors.  A  testament  to  the  true  depravity  that  inhabits  the  souls  of  man.  
The  little  girl  who  escaped  the  demonic  forces  which  occupied  the  LaLaurie  New  Orleans  mansion  on  a  sunny  day  in  1833,  though,  called  it  something  else:  the  site  of  a  rebirth.  The  little  girl  swore  on  that  day  that  she  would  never  be  anyone  else’s  victim,  and  so  began  a  centuries  long  campaign  of  bloody  revenge.  The  Retribution  Cabal  (RC)  was  born,  protecting  only  those  descendants  of  America’s original sin.  
Now  on  a  cyberpunk  stage  where  technological  wonders  leave  no  place  for  creatures  of  legend,  the  LaLauries  and  their  denizens  reappear,  continuing  their  blood-soaked  quest  for  obtaining  ultimate  power.  Time  will  tell  if  the  remaining  members  of  the  fractured  Cabal  can  stand  as  the  bulwark  between  humanity  and  the  rising  hordes  of  darkness.  
THE CHARACTERS
LAYLA
A  hired  gun͟,  Layla  lives  her  life  fast  and  loose.  Doesn’t  answer  to  anyone  and  shirks  responsibility.  Drafted  for  the  Retoch  Frontier Wars, she  was  one  of  the  more  talented  recruits,  but  didn’t  like  the  stifling/  authoritative  environment  of  the  military.  Added  to  that,  she  questioned  the  Manifest  Destiny͟ rhetoric  of  Earth’s  forces  and  was  promptly  kicked  out.  With  all  the  training  that  she’d  received,  and  no  shortage  of  crap  on  Earth  to  weed  through,  she  became  a  mercenary  for  hire.  She finds herself reluctantly pulled into the shadowy war of The Retribution Cabal.
TRAVIS
An operative of the Retribution Cabal. A  recent  recruit  in  the  organizations  fight  against  against the demonic/ supernatural hordes which exist back home Earth.  Travis is a gifted pilot, and trained  in  various  forms  of  hand  to  hand  combat,  and adept at using a variety of high  tech  weaponry. Travis is a  veteran  of  the  Retoch  Frontier  Wars  which  took  place  with  humanity’s  push  to  the  farthest  reaches  of  the  universe.  He was recruited  by  Prya  when  he  got  back  home  to  join the ranks of The Retribution Cabal.
PRYA
A ranking member of the Retribution Cabal. Even in a  world  of  the  far-flung  future The Retribution Cabal has  still  found  itself  busy  fighting  for  the  disenfranchised  in  a  world  beset  by  the  terrors  that  go bump in the night.  Prya  is  at  the  forefront  of  this  fight,  being  tasked  to  recruit  the  best  and  brightest  to  join the ranks of a failing organization.
LIANA MATTHEWS
The current head of The Retribution Cabal. She’s made it her goal to continue the fight of the fractured organization, by any means necessary.
THE LaLAURIES
History tells of the horrors which this couple meted out in a French Quarter mansion. The Retribution Cabal has made it its goal to ensure that the couple is wiped from existence, but the LaLaurie’s have always been able to stay one step ahead of the group. 
A LOOK INSIDE
Page 1, Inks to Colors to Letters.
Pages 1-6
THE CREATIVE TEAM
ROBERT JEFFREY II - Writer
A freelance writer with over 14 years of experience, Robert Jeffrey II was chosen along with 5 other writers (out of more than a thousand applicants,) to take part in the 2017 DC Comics Writers Workshop. His comic book writing includes DC Comics’ New Talent Showcase 2018 #1, the Glyph Comics Award nominated/ winning comic book series Route 3, and Radio Free Amerika. Robert is also a recipient of the 2008 Miller Brewing Company A. Philip Randolph Messenger /Journalism Award of Excellence in the field of AIDS/Health.
He is the editor In chief of BlackSci-Fi.com and has contributed to such anthologies as Dark Universe: The Bright Empire, and Scribes of Nyota. His client work includes work done for the Centers for Disease Control, RPG developer New Agenda Publishing, and Japanese tire manufacturer, Nitto Tires. He currently co-hosts the New Wakanda Podcast and A Light In The Sky: A 4400 Recap Podcast.
MATTEO ILLUMINATI - Artist
Matteo Illuminati is a comic book artist and illustrator  from Rome,Italy. He has worked  on Manfont Yamazaki 18 years Apocrypha vol.1, Wilder Online Kersos #4, Segni d’Autore Space Anabasis vol.4 and now on the Evoluzione Publishing Mine To Avenge series. You can follow Matteo Illuminati on all his social sites.  
LORIS RAVINA - Colorist/Letterer
Loris Ravina is a cartoonist born in Turin (Italy) in 1994. 
After studying art in International School of Comics, he collaborated to various projects as a freelance.
He has worked as colorist on "Kersos" #4 by Wilder Online.
Now he's working as colorist and letterist on "Mine To Avenge" by Evoluzione Publishing, and as character and props designer on cartoons by Enanimation.
THE REWARDS

campaign.story:
The Books
"Gumgah and the Grumpledonk" is illustrated by Micheline Hess (Malice in Ovenland), and follows the bedtime of a young girl named Gumgah, who is convinced there’s something scary in her closet. After failing to convince her parents of the existence of the monster the brave little girl decides to take matters into her own hands, and in doing so meets the creature known as the Grumpledonk. Readers will find out how Gumgah handles this encounter as the story unfolds. Preview Pages
 “The Booger Queen” is illustrated by Christine Larsen (Cartoon Network, Simon & Schuster), and follows an impassioned conversation with a diverse group of kids on a beautiful summer’s night. The children debate the existence of the Booger Queen, one-upping each other in rhyming verse sure to stay with young readers. The kids talk about where she lives, what she eats, and more. As the conversation gets out of hand, the youngest of them all asks a powerful question. Work In Progress
Rewards
Books
(Both will be 8" x 8" in size)
Custom individual, social media portrait (400px by 400px) of you (or your kid) by Micheline Hess in the style of Gumgah and the Grumpledonk. Micheline will illustrate them first come first served. Depending on the number of requests, the illustration will be done within a month at the latest. 
  Buttons
Bookmarks
Mini Prints
Original inked pages from The Booger Queen book
The Team
Jacques Nyemb
Writer/Publisher
Husband to Wonder Woman and father to Thing 1 and Thing 2, Jacques Nyemb's life is never dull. When he's not writing his millionth script, you can find him passed out under a pile of hats he wears as he runs Not So Super Publishing.
Twitter | Instagram | Facebook
Micheline Hess 
Artist - Gumgah and the Grumpledonk
Born and raised in NYC, Micheline Hess works as a designer at a prominent ad agency and spends her spare time developing graphic novels, short stories, and interactive iBooks for kids. She has always been interested in the portrayal of black people in visual narratives like comics and movies and is constantly endeavoring to weave her own sense of humorous story-telling into both her personal and sometimes professional work. Micheline is most adept at creating characters and stories that provide a safe and fun way to inspire young children, especially girls. Through colorful flights of fun and fancy, she hopes to encourage a stronger sense of self-love, friendship, and a hunger to embrace all things new and different in the world around them.
Twitter | Instagram | Facebook  
Christine Larsen
Artist - The Booger Queen
Originating from the Pine Barrens of central Jersey, Christine is a Harvey Award Nominated cartoonist and Illustrator, creating art for comics, book covers, stories, posters, and websites. She has worked with clients such as Dark Horse, IDW, BOOM Studios, DC Online, Saatchi & Saatchi, Simon & Schuster and Cartoon Network. She is also an adjunct instructor at The University of the Arts and Deleware College of Art and Design where she teaches courses in sequential art and comics. Christine resides in a heavily fortified North Philadelphia row home with her two cats, very awesome husband, wee son and a sawed-off shotgun. She patiently awaits the zombie apocalypse.
Twitter | Instagram | Facebook
Beverly Bambury
Editor (both books)  
Beverly Bambury edits comics and picture books, and is also a publicist and DIY publicity coach for authors and comic creators. She works with anyone from the occasional self-published author to creator-owned comics, all the way up to authors with major publishers. She's a Florida transplant living in Ontario, Canada, and yes: hilarity ensued.
Twitter | Facebook
The Goal:  
The initial goal is to raise the funds to get our books and the additional rewards produced and shipped. Any money raised beyond the initial goal will unlock more specialty Stretch Goal items, including limited-edition prints, bookmarks and many more surprises as we reach each goal.
About Not So Super Publishing:
Not So Super Publishing prides itself on creating diverse stories with diverse creators. Its approach is welcoming new readers, of all walks of life, who want something more from comics and publishing. NSSP started out publishing all-ages comics such as This Bites, Smörgåsbord Squad, and the flagship title Not So Super. Founder Jacques Nyemb and NSSP were featured in many media outlets such as Raleigh’s News and Observer, Spectrum News in North Carolina, and popular book site Tor.com. NSSP has also contributed to Jerome Walford’s award-winning anthology, Gwan and the New Frontier anthology.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've had two previously successful publishing Kickstarters (campaign and fulfillment) in the past and are confident that with your help, we'll have a third.

The books are still being illustrated and are scheduled to go to press by mid-December 2017. I will be using a printing vendor I have used in the past and do not anticipate any issues.

We are aware shipping costs can mount quickly, so we have ensured that we've factored in all shipping costs. We plan on shipping in January after the holiday rush. 

I’ll keep backers posted on any issues that might occur and am happy to answer comments and messages!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
