campaign.story:
$16,000 STRETCH GOAL REACHED!! STRETCH GOAL #2 - $18,000!
DIGITAL PACKAGE DEAL
Cubicles #1 by Walter Ostlie 
 Zulu #1 by Alverne Ball 
 Shiver Bureau #1 by Walter Ostlie 
 Barrdok the Wanderer #1 by Mike Priebe 
DayBlack #1 by Keef Cross 
 Kid Code: Channel Zero #1 by John Jennings, Stacey Robinson and Damian Duffy 
 Voodoo Detective: Midnight Offering by R. Thomas Favino, Dominic Black, and Laura Lee 
 Bounce! by Chuck Collins 
 Aceblade #1 by Danny J Quick, Christopher Hollars, and Vhon Remot 
Princess LovePon #1 by Shauna J. Grant 
 Malice in Ovenland #1 by Micheline Hess 
 Mythworlde Magazine by Gerald Boney 
 Tribal Quest (from Humanescent anthology) by Jacques E Nyemb, Derick Jones, and Justin Wood 
 The Stronger by Chris Ward, Samir Simão, and Keithan Jones 
So not only do you get copies of Is'nana the Were-Spider Vol 2, but your rewards and 14 free digital comics if we get to the $18,000! Tell a friend or two!
GOAL REACHED!! STRETCH GOAL #1 NEXT - $16,000!!
THE CROSSOVER EVENT!! 
Stretch Goal Crossover Event by Vol 1's Walter Ostlie!
Given that my character Is’nana and his father, Anansi the Spider, have been established with the ability to travel through different worlds, I thought it’d be fun to take advantage of this and introduce people to different books and series in the indie comic world. With the stretch goal of $16,000, the Is’nana team are hoping to raise enough money to add 40 extra pages of story content to allow Is’nana to go through these different worlds, each illustrated by their respective creators. The goal is to raise enough money to pay all the artists/creators involved.
So we have Vol 1's artist Walter Ostlie's Shiver Bureau, Micheline Hess' Malice in Ovenland, Shauna J. Grant's Princess LovePon, Chuck DragonBlack Collins' Bounce!, Keef Cross' DayBlack, Mike Priebe's Barrdok the Wanderer, and N Steven Harris' and Robert Garrett's Ajala! I thought it'd be great to do a sort of cross promotion between each creator and books and given that I have a good set of readers and fanbases, I'm hoping I can not only introduce readers to more Black folklore and mythological characters, but also get more people into other indie books and franchises. If anyone is able to jump in to help, that'd be wonderful, or even spreading the word and discussing what the mission goal is! So please pledge today and spread the word!
THE STORY
A horror-fantasy, coming of age story, Is'nana the Were-Spider: The Hornet's Web is the second part to an on-going series of one-shots/graphic novels.
Is'nana the Were-Spider, Vol 2 Cover
Accidentally breaking a barrier between our world and theirs (called THE MOTHER KINGDOM), Is'nana (the son of Anansi the Spider God of Stories) accepts the responsibility for releasing creatures of horror into our reality, villains who want nothing more but to cause chaos and mayhem to achieve their own diabolical or selfish goals. With guidance from his father, Is'nana not only strives to live up to his father's name but to also reach his own potential while he seeks to discover his individuality and place in the world.
 After defeating Osebo the Leopard, Is'nana must now face Queen Mmboro, her daughter Princess Kantite, and their family of hornets, wasps, and bees who unite and seek to inject themselves into human beings and take over our reality. 
Queen Mmboro and her Harvest
  Attack of the Killer Were-Bees
 Unfortunatley caught amongst the mayhem is the Baptiste family, Leland, Gina, and Jenka, who fight to survive and protect each other at all cost against Queen Mmboro's evil hive...
The Baptiste Family
 ...while Is'nana must not only test his physically limits but also deal with rising tensions with his father who sees fit to control and protect his every move.
Tension between Father and Son
Be sure to Like and Follow the Facebook Page. 
THE MISSION
Last year since the success of the Kickstarter for Vol. 1 of Is'nana the Were-Spider and following the official publication release, the book has been met with acclaim, new fans, and supporters. Fans of Anansi the Spider were welcomed with a modern take on the old mythological folklore of West Africa and the Caribbean, while new fans were introduced to rich characters from old (and sometimes forgotten) stories. Just as the last volume, I hope to continue to make sure these characters and stories are not being forgotten, as Is'nana pushes forth to continue on the legacy of Africana and Black-based folklore and mythology. Your support, donations, while sharing this project through friends, family, and social media will help to further continue this mission.
Anansi the Spider and Papa Legba of Haitian Stories
I am hoping to use the funds raised to print copies of not only Vol 2, but reprints of Vol 1 that is currently sold out. This Kickstarter will also allow new readers to pledge for a copy of Volume 1 and catch up with the mission. 
Vol 1 (currently sold out) and Vol 2
 WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?
Just like last year, the production of the book from pencils, inks, colors, and lettering are being paid out of pocket. We are currently almost half way through the coloring stages and will begin lettering soon. Money raised will go to final production and printing physical copies of Vol 2 and reprints of Vol 1 (currently sold out) for backers, stores/retailers, libraries, and conventions. Money will also be going into merchandise, rewards, shipping, and Kickstarter fees.
THE TEAM
Gregory Anderson-Elysee is the writer and creator of Is'nana: The Were-Spider. On pencils and inks is Daryl Toh (Outer God), with Lee Milewski (Hunter's Lore) providing colors, Joshua Cozine (The Untamed) on letters and production, and last but not least Walt Msonza Barna on the covers!
 REWARDS
            Daryl Toh (Vol 2 artist)
  Chris Giarusso (G-Man, Mini Marvels)
  Miguel Blanco (OogeeMan)
  Line work by Levi Fari-Raqub / Colors by Leonard Anderson
  Chris Koehler (Legend)
              Greg Anderson-Elysee (Is'nana Writer/Creator)
  Scott Bratek
   +Add $50 to Original Pin Up Print Pledge for ALL 7 Pin Ups
       - Anansi the Spider
- Is'nana the Were-Spider 
- Is'nana the Were-Spider (Spider Form) 
- Papa Legba, Loa God of the Crossroads
 - Queen Mmboro 
- Osebo the Leopard
- Kantite, daughter of Queen Mmboro 
    (Add $15 to original Pins pledge for all 7 Pins)
               4 T-shirts to Choose From
                 -  Change Pledge $70 (instead of $50) for 2 different Is'nana T-shirts, or $100 for all 4 T shirts.
  Custom Is'nana Funko Pop Vinyl Toy
    3 of 28 Original Pages from Is'nana Vol 1
     Add Ons and Prices
If you wish to add in an extra reward to your pledge, read below for the prices of the Add On which you will put in addition to your pledge. Please note that Add Ons will not be included in the PDF reward tiers unless a physical copy is pledged.
   ALSO!! VERY IMPORTANT:: BE SURE TO SEND ME A MESSAGE TO CONFIRM YOUR ADD ON TO YOUR PLEDGE!!!
_______________________________________________________________
ALSO... STRETCH GOAL!! $16,000
If the initial goal is exceeded into the next goal (16,000), an added 40 pages of story will be included in the book for no extra charge. The art will be drawn by Vol 1's artist Walter Ostlie (Shiver Bureau).
The story will follow Is'nana on a mission from Papa Legba, the Haitian Loa God of the Crossroads, to find his dog who's gone missing due to Is'nana breaking the barrier between worlds in Vol 1. Unfortunately, other trickster characters from Haitian folklore, Ti-Malice, Bouki, and Kompere Chat have other plans for Legba's dog. Also entangled with his own motive is Jeremy Tableau, a trickster guided by Legba himself, there to ensure Is'nana's quest is not an easy one...
The Black Sheep, Jeremy Tableau (stretch goal character)
 The story will also feature crossovers and interactions with characters from  other indie comic book properties like Shiver Bureau by Walter Ostlie, Bounce! the Comic by Chuck Collins, Malice in Ovenland by Micheline Hess, DayBlack by Keef Cross, Barrdok the Wanderer by Mike Priebe, Princess LovePon by Shauna J. Grant, and Ajala: A Series of Adventures by N Steven Harris.
Behind the Scenes, Princess LovePon, Is'nana and Jeremy are preparing for the Kickstarter!
  Hanging out with the cast of Shiver Bureau!
  Anansi makes a surprise guest visit in Malice in Ovenland set
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The last Kickstarter (Vol 1) was successful and backers received their books and rewards were fulfilled. I am expecting Vol 2 book to be fully completed before the end of the year, but added time was added in case of any unexpected delay. Although Vol 2 is already currently being funded, the added pages, if we achieve the stretch goals, may add to a longer wait time for the book due to not just the pages from Ostlie, but also the pages from the guest creators and their properties. I still aim to release the book well ahead of the listed expected date.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

WOW!!! We made past $8,000 of our $10,000 goal within the first two days of the campaign!! I am beyond grateful for everyone coming on board on this journey with me and the Is'nana team. This book has been a long time coming and we want to thank you from the bottom of our hearts for believing in us and supporting us bring this book to life and hopefully into your hands and screens!

updates.update_userinfo: Monday! New Is'nana the Were-Spider Kickstarter Campaign! It's Showtime!
updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone! Despite the last few months of madness that we have all been going through, I hope things are well. My heart goes out to everyone who has been dealing with any type of hardship. I've been using a lot of this time to keep myself busy and have also been working on the next Is'nana the Were-Spider one shot. A 64 page comic, Is'nana  the Were-Spider finds himself squared up against his next challenge:  breaking dancing in the streets of New York City! It's Showtime!
Launching this coming Monday, August 31st. Joining the team is Miguel Blanco on pencils and inks, Angael Davis-Cooper on colors, Deron Bennett/AndWorld on letters, and a short story by David Brame.

updates.update_content:
We're in the last day of the Modern Mythology: The Heroes' Journey Kickstarter campaign and as of this update we need less than $1000 to reach our funding goal!
This new anthology includes the most recent Is'nana the Were-Spider story which was created for this book and I think you guys will love it! So if you haven't had the opportunity yet, please check it out and jump on board! Mine will be one of many great modern adaptions of myths from all over the world, so if you're into myths or folklore, it's right up your alley!

updates.update_userinfo: New Is'nana Story + New Niobe from Stranger Comics!!
updates.update_content: First I want to thank everyone who have been able to jump on board to the new anthology on Kickstarter, Modern Mythology: The Hero's Journey! This book includes the next Is'nana the Were-Spider story, which was created for this book. It was based on a West African proverb and a story I stumbled on and it's one I'm very proud of. I was able to reconnect with David Brame and Deron Bennett on this piece and I think we have another winner. So many pages I want to share but am afraid of spoilers! I'm one who loves surprises!

updates.update_userinfo: New Is'nana the Were-Spider story in Modern Myth Anthology!
updates.update_content: Good day, everyone! I hope you're all well! Some updates on Is'nana: currently working behind the scenes on two new Is'nana the Were-Spider stories. Both very different from each other but I'm sure you all will enjoy immensely! It will be a while until the Kickstarters will be announced, unfortunately. But in the mean time, there IS a new Is'nana story that will exclusively be found in a new anthology, MODERN MYTHOLOGY! An anthology that collects various modern mythology adaptions from various cultures and fits right into the themes of Is'nana!

campaign.story:
An explosive scene of action from Route 3 #3. Pencils/ inks Sean Damien Hill. Colors, Omi Remalante
  Route 3 is a super-powered road trip from hell. A Stone Mountain, GA teen finds out he’s been granted with a set of spectacular abilities, that he knows nothing about. He’s now on the run from a wide array of folks in a sort of super powered arms race across the Southeastern United States. Explosions, gunfights, telekinetic feats of awesomeness, and a little personal growth are all thrown into the mix.
We've collected all three issues of the first story arc into a superb collected edition that also includes a cover page gallery, "DVD" extras, and a forward by the talented artist/ writer Takeia Marie (Contributor to Rosarium Publishing's APB: Artists Against Police Brutality). 
Route 3 piece of art by Takeia Marie, featuring series protagonist, Sean Anderson
We are raising funds primarily to get the completed collected edition, Route 3 Vol. 1, printed.
Let me repeat this: 
THE BOOK IS FINISHED. COMPLETE. IN THE CAN. 
All three issues of the award winning comic book series are completed, and are ready to be placed into your hands.
All we literally need to do is raise funds for copies of the collected graphic novel, get the finished copy to the printer, and get the book in to readers, new and old. In addition to this, we're hoping to use these same funds to begin to get the books into a variety of locations, including future conventions, comic book stores, book stores, and libraries.
In addition to getting the book into you our awesome contributors, we have other perks available as rewards, and as possible stretch goals as you can see on the right side of this page.
The series has been featured on such websites as Comic Book Resources, Black Girl Nerds, Bleeding Cool News, and Comic Crusaders, won the 2014 Glyph Comics Award for Best Cover, and was nominated for the 2017 Glyph Comics Award for Best Reprint Publication for Route 3 Vol 1. 
Check out some of the awesome pieces of art from the Route 3 series with pencils/ inks by Sean Hill, colors by Ann Siri O'Brien and Omi Remalante, and award winning cover art by Anthony "Antboi" Piper.
The Route 3 Vol 1. cover, pencils/ inks by Sean Hill, colors by Lavata O'Neal
  L-R. Kickstarter Exclusive Route 3 Pin Ups by Don Hillsman (Radio Free Amerika, Scion,Gambit: House of Cards), and Sean Hill (Route 3, Dark Shaman, Jaycen Wise and The Secret of The Rose)
                                  Interior of Route 3: Vol 1
  Interior of Route 3: Vol 1
  Interior of Route 3: Vol 1
  Back of Route 3: Vol 1
  Spine of Route 3: Vol 1
    For the 75.00 donation level you can get both Route 3: Vol. 1, and Radio Free Amerika: Season 1
  Route 3 Team Bios (aka People You Need to Hire For Your Next Project): 
Robert Jeffrey II (Writer/ Creator): 
 Robert Jeffrey II is a freelance writer based out of Atlanta, GA, and his portfolio includes work in print/ web journalism, and comics. He’s written for J’Adore Magazine, The Atlanta Voice Newspaper, and Urban Voices in Comics. He is a guest contributor to the TesseraGuild.com and is the Editor In Chief for BlackSci-Fi.com. His comics work includes the creator owned titles Route 3 and Daddy’s Little Girl. 
His other comic book work includes contracted client work such as the Glyph Comic Award nominated Radio Free Amerika,Terminus Team Up #1, Stealth: The Life and Times of Allen White, and Soul of Suw. He’s also handled co-scripting/editing duties for clients such as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and international tire manufacturer Nitto Tires. 
Robert is a recipient of the 2008 Miller Brewing Company A. Philip Randolph Messenger Award/ Journalism Award of Excellence in the field of AIDS/Health, and his creator owned series, Route 3, won the 2014 Glyph Comics Award for Best Cover. In 2016 he was named as one of ComicsAlliance.com’s “20 Black Comic Book Creators on the Rise”.  In 2017 Route 3 Vol 1 was nominated for the Glyph Comics Award for Best Reprint Publication. 
He’s yet fulfilled his dream of pop-locking to save a community center.
Sean Damien Hill (Pencils/ Inks): 
Sean Damien Hill is a Washington, D.C native who is an accomplished artist, with specialties including fine arts, comic book penciling, and inking. Sean’s credits include penciling/ inking on such comic books as the Route 3 series, Terminus Team Up #1, and Vegas Baby. Sean Hill’s work has appeared in Jaycen Wise and The Secret of The Rose, and he is a part of the award winning creative team of which received numerous awards at the 2014 HBO/Cinemax Sponsored Urban Action Expo Awards. Sean was the penciller/ inker on the critically acclaimed, Zenescope Entertainment mini-series, Dark Shaman, and has contributed cover art to the upcoming Deathforce series.  
Anthony Piper (Cover Artist): 
Anthony “Antboi” Piper (Blk Ant) is a self-taught Chicago based illustrator & designer. Being a lover of video games, comics, cartoons, manga and hip-hop, he’s focused his career on providing illustration and design work for companies and artists in these particular industries. He also has a passion for advertising and marketing, and is highly conscious when it comes to aligning his illustrative style in accordance to his client’s “brand” in order to adapt and create a unique look for their product and marketing campaign.He received the Glyph Comics Award for Best Cover of 2014, for his cover work on Terminus Media’s Route 3 #2. Anthony is the creator of the popular Trill League series, and his numerous credits/client list includes work for Marvel Comics, the IDW Comics published Blaze Brothers series, and work as lead character designer on FOX TV’s Major Lazer and Axe Cop animated series. 
Colorist Ann Siri Obrien's awesome work from Route 3 #1
Ann Siri O'Brien (Colors): 
Ann Siri is a freelance illustrator based in Philadelphia, USA. She is experienced in many different mediums from water colors to computer and vector imaging. Her credits include work on Terminus Media’s Route 3 and Hound Comics Ultravixen series.
Omi Remalante Jr. (Colors): 
Omi Remalante Jr. was born and raised in Manila, Philippines. His passion for comic books goes a long way starting at the early age of 5. He has worked on such titles such as Zenescope Entertainment's Dark Shaman, Grimm Fairy Tales: Holiday Edition, Grimm Fairy Tales Presents Robyn Hood, Valiant Comics Unity, Ivar, Timewalker, and Terminus Media’s Route 3 series. 
Lavata O'Neal (Graphic Novel Cover Colorist):
Lavata O'neal is an illustrator/concept artist, who draws and paints for a living. Her work has been featured in The Gorgon Medusa book series, the Beyond The Balance Saga, the ASMA comic book serious, the Speak Easy Tonight mobile game app, Fifty Shades of Fantasy mobile game app, and The Mortal  Odyssey book series.
Khari Sampson (Letters/ Copy Editing):
Khari Sampson is an Atlanta based letterer/ copy editor whose credits include Terminus Media’s Route 3, Radio Free Amerika, The Gilded Age, Geist, and Terminus Team Up.
Route 3 Vol. 1 Stretch Goals
We’ve hit our goal, but we’ve got a couple of stretch goals for some awesome incentives to hit before the end of the campaign. Check 'em out.:  
*1st Route 3 Vol. 1 Stretch Goal: $5250
An example of Nick Freeman's artwork on his creator owned series Voo. All Original characters and illustrations are the property of Nicholas Freeman © 2013
 -Original digital Route 3 Nick Freeman print.  
As mentioned on his website, Nick Freeman is a “ 2D artist working in Comics and Game development. He specializes in sequential art through the use of story boards and comics.” His clients include the SyFy network, and Marvel Animation.  
With an Instagram following of 3,910 followers Nick is an extremely talented artist who we’re glad to have on board with donating his talents to bringing the world of Route 3 to life in this exclusive digital Route 3 print.  
This will be exclusive to pledges at the tier level of $5 and above. Check out some of his awesome work featuring characters from his creator owned series, Voo.
An example of Nick Freeman's artwork on his creator owned series Voo. All Original characters and illustrations are the property of Nicholas Freeman © 2013
  An example of Nick Freeman's artwork on his creator owned series Voo. All Original characters and illustrations are the property of Nicholas Freeman © 2013
 *2nd Route 3 Vol 1. Stretch Goal: $6700
316, Salma, and Khenan in action.
 -A prequel to Route 3, Route 3: Origins #1 (Working Title)  
An 8 page digital comic book short story focusing on one of 316, Salma, and Khenan’s early missions, before the events of Route 3. Think Jason Bourne, with a dash of Zero Dark Thirty, and you have a tale which will be world spanning, action packed, and will show the trio of agents at their finest hour.  
Written by yours truly, Route 3 creator/ writer, Robert Jeffrey II, penciled/ inked/ colored by series artist Sean Damien Hill, and lettered by series letterer, Khari J. Sampson.  
The story will be available for pledges at the tier level of $12 and above.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk for this would quite simply be not raising the money. :-)

Since the book has already been laid out, we just need to get it to the printer, and shipped. With an 8-10 week turnaround with our printer, we will begin shipping hard copies of the books (along with copies of Terminus books for donors at the $100-$300 level) towards the end of August, beginning of September .

Digital copies of the books, digital wallpaper, and digital prints will begin to be sent out in June for all backers. 

With this being the first Kickstarter for our team, please have patience as we get these packages shipped out. Our goal is to get them out in a timely fashion, but in the case of any delays with getting the shipments out we will reach out to you to give updates.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
dodl.es’ mobile app offers easy animation with collaboration, leading to incredible new opportunities for creative expression!
Users can rapidly create animated scenes using their own content or by mixing, matching and tweaking animated characters and content created by others.
Over the past decade, social media has evolved from text-based posts, emojis, and photos to more visually engaging memes, video with overlays and digital drawings to provide users with the ability to express themselves more creatively than ever before. dodl.es will fuel the next big leap in self-expression, removing the barriers for digital drawing, animation, and collaboration over social media.
In today’s fast-paced digital world, there is increasing demand for visual communication in order to stand out. Animation is at the forefront of effective communication and expression but has historically been a time-consuming, technical process. dodl.es has simplified this process to help users create impressive animations faster than ever.
  By leveraging the creative content of others through dodl.es' open marketplace, users can produce animated stories (or “dodles”) without requiring drawing or animation skills.  The user simply searches for pre-animated characters, objects, and scenes they want to add to their dodle, and selects licensed assets to tweak, if necessary.  Users can then quickly develop a dodle, visually directing these assets by selecting actions and recording audio for characters to lip sync to.
dodl.es is positioning itself as an advocate for creators by offering new revenue streams for those publishing animated stories and those wanting to license scenes, objects, characters, sound effects, music, and voice acting, while also protecting their intellectual property.
The groundbreaking animation techniques within dodl.es  revolutionize the process of creating animated messages, memes, interactive comics, stories, games and more. The capabilities of the app appeal to both the casual hobbyist looking to create the next viral meme as well as the serious professional seeking to produce interactive advertising more efficiently.
We put dodl.es to the test and let you be the judge.
      Craig Doriot has worked hard to overcome the challenges of autism and believes dodl.es will be a tool that helps those on the spectrum build effective outlets for their incredible gifts. It will help them forge careers without being hindered by the social stresses that leads to underemployment.
dodl.es is engaging creators, artists, and fans through participation at popular comic cons including the recent & upcoming exhibits at Wondercon (april 2017, Anaheim, CA), C2E2 (April 2017, Chicago, IL), Wizard World Minneapolis (May 2017), and Comicpalooza (May 2017).
Press
We've begun receiving some positive press:
WBAY TV interview
Live Interview with Spaceboy Universe: 
Live Interview with Thorngard Art (Professional Animator)
Interview by Warped Films
Article by Game skinny
Article by First Comics News
We had a lot of positive reactions at the shows from people checking out the app, so we started to record a few of them:
https://www.facebook.com/dodles/videos/vb.562729740535601/896131517195420/?type=3&theater https://www.facebook.com/dodles/videos/vb.562729740535601/898150590326846/?type=3&theater https://www.facebook.com/dodles/videos/pcb.898229076985664/898228950319010/?type=3&theater 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R5TMZln9JKM at 1:45 
our booth at C2E2
   Beyond the "regulars" above, please check out our staff page to see the other 25+ significant contributors to this project.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The physical rewards have been worked out in advance, so we foresee no risks to delivery.

dodl.es is a technology solution that is about 80% complete for beta launch but relies on the availability of its technology staff and additional funding, though it can reduce plans short to hit deadlines if necessary. 

Craig Doriot has a strong history of building successful tech startups from initial idea to sale (co-founder of Yupi who sold to Microsoft and Loansifter who sold to Optimal Blue).

updates.update_content:
Thanks for your patience as we've been working hard to get dodles into beta.  We are now ready to rollout the first pass of beta, and start gathering your feedback.  As mentioned, we had to scale back features temporarily to get this stable across all devices, but will soon be ramping them back up after launch.
We will be sending out a poll in the next couple of days asking if you are looking to access from android or ios device so that we can setup your access in Google Play or iTunes.  One of the first things we will be adding is weekly prize contests for dodles posted from our app to other social media platforms and choosing the best ones!

updates.update_userinfo: Successful Kickstart: Thanks to all you backers!
updates.update_content:
On behalf of the staff at dodles, we thank you for your support and generosity in backing our project!  Definitely was a close finish, but you guys pulled through.
On the marketing side, we will continue to focus on anime and comic cons, where we have been finding considerable traction engaging millennials (1800 unique email contacts from our last show).   We are still learning on the PR side, but have begun receiving some local (TV news segment) and niche press during these shows and otherwise.  Our combined social reach is now at about 10,000 people and another 5,000 email list.  For dodles to be successful, it needs considerable community support and so we will continue to search for ways to expand this affordably.

Looks like this project is coming down to the wire on kickstarter!  

Thanks for all of the support so far, and please consider any additional support you can offer, whether that be reaching to friends who may find the project of interest, posting to social sites, or upping your pledge!
It's been a very busy couple of weeks as we have been finishing up a major release internally, and exhibiting at Momo Con in Atlanta where we found considerable interest at our first anime convention.  We will definitely be making anime a primary marketing focus going forward based on the strong reaction we experienced!

Hey Backers!
So much has been going on, lots to discuss!  We attended Comicpalooza last week in Houston, TX and received interest from over 800 contacts, making it our most productive exhibit to date, with considerable buzz at our booth.  Here are a couple of interviews we did at the show:
Spaceboy Universe:

Thank you so much for backing us for a successful first 2 days. We peaked at #6 out of #320 projects in the "Art" category, and currently stand at #10! 
We have also been livestreaming and taking other videos from wizard world Minneapolis to help promote our kickstarter launch and will be doing the same from comicpalooza in Dallas next week!  We can sense a buzz growing from vendors and regulars with each show and we capture some of the footage of people's reactions and other media from the show:

campaign.story:
Agent Solo Cover Image
  Agent Solo is a bionic super solder who thwarts national security threats for the NSA. In this epic one shot adventure Agent Solo is tasked with taking down a villain  who has been targeting banks, federal agents and witnesses to high profile cases known as Sledgehammer. Will Agent Solo be able to stop this menace? And more importantly, will Agent Solo be able to uncover who Sledgehammer is truly working for? Check out some of the interior pages below!
        Most of the production on this book as well as the rewards have already been completed. I just need your help to cover printing costs on the project as well as shipping costs for delivery of the final product. I have a ton of AWESOME concept images for t-shirts, prints, and posters that are included as rewards...but the manufacturing costs associated with those items are a bit more than I can cover out of my own pockets. That's why I'm coming to Kickstarter for your help! Speaking of those rewards.....
As previously mentioned I have come up with a ton of great rewards beyond the actual book. Those rewards range from exclusive pin ups, to t-shirts and even Agent Solo action figures that were produced by the good folks at Short Fuse Media Group!
Exclusive Pin Up by Chandar Wilson
  Exclusive Pin Up by Disney/Marvel Artist -Christian Colbert
  Exclusive Pin Up by Disney/Marvel Artist -Christian Colbert
  Exclusive Pin Up by Marvel and Image Comics Artist Jon Malin
  TEAM SOLO / AGENT SOLO TEES
  Agent Solo Mug - Taste the action!!!
  Agent Solo Action Figure
   Fresh off an appearance in Short Fuse Media Group's "Heroes: Ignited Anthology" Agent Solo will appear alongside a few of these heroes AGAIN in a special mini story / crossover that will be action packed!!! [NOTE: This will not be the story that was featured in the Heroes: Ignited Anthology. This will be an ALL NEW story.]
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Before I decided to come to Kickstarter, I wanted my comic to be 100% completed before asking anyone to support so that once the campaign was over I could head straight to the printer to get the project into your hands. Thus far everything has been paid for out of pocket and and I have been successful in that effort. The additional funding raised through Kickstarter is to help get the finished product printed so that everyone can enjoy this awesome story! 

Thank you all for your support in this project. I've been working on this project for a long time and having your help to see it through will be greatly appreciated!!!

Raymond
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What is Tuskegee Heirs?: From the minds of illustrator Marcus Williams (Hero Cats, Super Natural and D.M.C) and children’s book author Greg Burnham (Broken Glass and Grandpa’s Shoes) comes the "Tuskegee Heirs: Flames of Destiny" series. Tuskegee Heirs is a futuristic sci-fi adventure that follows a squadron of young, gifted aviators who are forced to become Earth’s last line of defense against a menacing race of artificially intelligent villains bent on destroying civilization.
Tuskegee Heirs team
What is The Premise: The duo looks to pay homage to the historic Tuskegee Airmen, while bringing forth a new set of character rich young heroes. With a graphic novel set to release mid 2016, Marcus and Greg intend to push this project towards animation. Following in the Japanese animation genre's age old practice of dropping unusually talented youths inside the cockpits of enormously powerful machines, the amazing pilots of this series will be no exception. 
Tuskegee Pilot "Able" & Mech
The Tuskegee Heirs will be set 80 years in the future where a world sculpted by rapid progressing technology will come to ban human pilots from operating aircraft and go as far as to criminalize the act of even training pilots. Our young pilots, however, have found a secret training facility and refuge in the historical airfield once used by the fabled WWII War Heroes, the Tuskegee Airmen.  Under the careful guidance of Col. Mars, a long retired veteran pilot, the team of young hopefuls are trained and educated about the strong ethics that made the classic airmen the formidable unit that they were. Not long into their training, a mysterious military force composed of highly advanced self-aware war machines fixated on destroying civilization as they know it, declares war on all societies. Suddenly the teens are thrust into the middle of a war for humanities' right to exist. They will have to use their training as pilots, knowledge of history, and unique skill sets to defeat this fearsome enemy. 
Tuskegee Heirs Pilot "Able"
Throughout the series, we plan to highlight not only the history of the Airmen and their accomplishments, but also expose some of the lesser known history of the world. From Easter Island to the pyramids of Sudan, the Cahokia mounds of the midwest to the Olmec heads of Mexico, the team will see and share it all.
Who are the Main Characters?
ABLE-
Able
One of the most naturally gifted pilots on the team, Able was born to fly and with the extended hands-on training from Col. Mars, he may quickly become the most skilled pilot on the planet.
AYANNA-
Ayanna
The team leader and strong moral compass that keeps the team in well oiled shape. A brilliant strategist and cool head under pressure, Ayanna was born to lead, and you'll be hard pressed to find a team member that will admit otherwise.  
OMAR-
Omar
The field mechanic on the team and talented tech specialist, Omar is a balanced pilot with strong will and a laid back demeanor. A hoarder of information, he proclaims himself a historian should the need for knowledge present itself.
GENESIS-
Genesis
 The brains of the outfit and team geographical/topographical expert that keeps the team up to date and informed on all mission details. An otherwise sweet and timid soul, Genesis comes alive in combat and is a truly fearsome force to be reckoned with.
SLIP-
Slip
The weapons expert of the team and thrill seeker with a cool head under pressure (sometimes too cool). The comic relief, Slip may be the shortest member on the team, but he boast the largest personality around. He often plays the dumb role to throw off his opponents only to later reveal just how sharp he truly is. 
Jena-
Jena the Mechanic
 Every bit the mechanical genius, Jena keeps the Tuskegee Heirs flying while obsessing over all things Hi-tech. Just don't damage her planes without just cause because that has proven to be problematic.
COL. MARS- 
Col. Mars
 The founding Tuskegee Heir. Mars is the guiding force for the kids and keeps them together with lessons of team building and core values that aid them in all of their endeavors. While he takes a backseat to the action overall, underestimating this original Tuskegee Heir would spell disaster for any opponent.
What will the comic look like? Stay tuned to both this page and the Tuskegee Heirs Facebook page as we will be releasing sample pages throughout the campaign to keep the eye candy flowing!
-Flames of Destiny Cover art concept:
Flames of Destiny
The Guys of Tuskegee Heirs
Road Trip
What's the purpose of the Kickstarter? We're crafting this story to merge everything we love about science fiction, action-adventure, comedy, and rich character growth, to highlighting historic jewels of information to create a unique series for all ages. 
Tuskegee Heirs Jet Concept
Creating a graphic novel is no small feat, so producing the art, securing the right printer, paying for the print run, to delivery of such a product will take careful planning and tons of energy. Tuskegee Heirs is something we consider unique and needed to help inspire, educate and morally boost our young generation into seeing what wonderful potential they all have. 
Kickstarter is a springboard platform that allows fans of this series to directly express their support by helping to financially fuel the creative art machine needed to produce and make this concept a reality. Everything from a comic, toy, animated cartoon, and video game series are possible. 
Tuskegee Heirs Mech Concept
Stretch Goals:
$15,000- ***(UNLOCKED)*** At this point we can craft for your reading & visual pleasure Issue #4 to tell a bit more of the story as it continues from (We'll send a digital copy to everyone who pledges $25 to $49. Physical copy to everyone who pledges $50 and up)
--------
$25,000- ***(UNLOCKED)*** Consider another graphic novel volume paid for and the birth of 3 more story issues (4-6) will be crafted. At this point we will be able to hire on some additional help to move things along which could result in less production time spent making the books. (We'll send a digital copy to everyone who pledges $50 to $79. Physical copy to everyone who pledges $80 and up)
Sma
--------
$35,000- ***(UNLOCKED)*** If we are able to reach $35,000, we'll proceed to create a Tuskegee Heirs T-Shirt line for Men, Women and Children. This means T-shirts that will feature character, vehicle and classic planes (for the aviator household out there).
T-Shirt Lineup
Youth Shirt Lineup
Smashed 35K
----------

$45,000 ***(UNLOCKED)*** At this goal, we will be able to move forward with producing a family geared board game and sweet mobile game app. We've already begun talks with game designers/developers that are excited about creating a unique mobile experience that anyone could enjoy while on the go via mobile devices.
Early Game designs
There will Absolutely be action and adventure that drive the player throughout the mobile game, but we are passionate about creatively crafting a gaming experience that charges our players to pull up Google as they progress to research the history for themselves. Here's some rough concepts of what could be.
Concept Game Art for the mobile app
$45K Mobile game UNLOCKED
-----------
$55,000-In the case that we raise $55,000, we'll get started with developing a full figurine lineup of all the Tuskegee Heirs Characters including the Jet and Mech for your viewing pleasure. These will be available in both resin and color 3D printed versions and will stand in various heights starting around 5 inches and up.
Figurine Lineup
-----------
$65,000-At this goal, there's no reason at all that we won't be able to produce a prototype toy of one of the characters and jets to approach toy manufactures with. We will start humbly and create the most clean working prototype that 3D printing will allow working with the same 3D artist that will help bring the figurines to life. Upon successfully producing the prototypes our goal will be to secure a toy line for the mass market.
----------

$75K and UP- ANIMATED PILOT (Short piece)
It is no secret that our ultimate goal is to get this concept animated into a series that can be enjoyed on monitors big and small. 
Rough Storyboards-1
Rough Storyboards-2
The short Pilot piece will be use as a pitch piece (proof of concept) since we plan to approach subscription networks like Netflix, Hulu or OnDemand to be the publishing house for our series in an effort to give fans direct unfiltered access to the animated show upon the successful completion of it's 1st season. 
Animation work in progress
Animation as a whole can be very expensive and even an animated short can have very steep estimates. The more support we have to reach this pilot goal, the more realistic the goal of crafting a proof of concept and later a full series will be. 
The ladies of Tuskegee Heirs
Thank you for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any creative project, there is a chance of delay before presenting a final product. The date of delivery of all backer rewards is an estimated date that hinges on printing. We'll make sure we keep all backers updated on the progress of this project and any delays as they arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Greetings to all!! After going through a couple months of formatting and shipping issues with our printer,the graphic novels have finally arrived. We will begin the shipping process as early as this weekend. There's a good chance that many of you have changed addresses over the course of this project, so please take time to update your address on Kickstarter as soon as possible. Feel free to private message us if you have any questions and or concerns.

We wanted to update you guys with pages and assurance that the 1st graphic novel will soon be in hand and ready to ship out to you. We deeply apologize for the production and update delays, but we've been juggling ALL aspects of the business that is publishing and creating a brand along with producing the book. In the last handful of months we have been making great headway into the realm of turning this property into an animated series and are hopeful that we'll have something awesome to share with you all soon. We'll be sending out a major blast to all our backers for final confirmations of your addresses and such as soon as we get the books back from the printer. We're more than aware of the extreme delivery delay inconvenience and we are gathering our forces to make a huge step up in production to rectify this issue moving forward. We truly appreciate all the support and well wishes from our backers and fans throughout this rough journey. Thank you.

campaign.story:
For the past four years, I've been a staple of the comic convention circuit, traveling across the country sharing my unique 8-Bit/Pixel fan-art with the world.  But in all that time, I've also been steadily producing some of the BEST comic book content to come out of the small-press, teaming up with some of the most EXCITING and TALENTED creators yet to work for a mainstream publisher!   Produced under my imprint, Vantage:Inhouse Productions, projects like The Trouble w/ Love (Harold Edge), Origins Unknown (Jacob Newell), The Samaritan (Ren McKinzie), and the newest, all-ages feature, Wonder Care Presents: The Kinder Guardians (Justin Castaneda) have been the BIGGEST SECRET comic readers have yet to discover -- despite sell-outs at multiple conventions in the 2015 season!
Wait.  The stories are written.  The pages are drawn and paid for.  And books have already gone to press...what gives?!  Yeah, this isn't your "typical" Kickstarter.  With this campaign, our goals are very simple and straightforward -- to get you, an invested fan-base of comic consumers, to collect and read our current library of books!  With a roster of 4 titles, each aiming for a separate demographic: All-Ages (The Kinder Guardians), Teen Friendly (Origins Unknown), Young Adult (The Trouble w/Love), and Mature (The Samaritan), we're sure we have SOMETHING to fit your readership tastes!  
Let me take a minute to tell you a bit about our books...
Wonder Care Presents: The Kinder Guardians #1
Wonder Care Presents: The Kinder Guardians
Written by Victor Dandridge
Art by Justin Castaneda
Rated A for All-Ages
#ForTheFansOf: Tiny Titans, Calvin & Hobbes, Billy Batson and the Magic of Shazam, G-Man, and Adventure Time!

Can you break the sound barrier or shoot lasers from your eyes?  Then join the school for the EXTREMELY gifted and talented -- WONDER CARE!  Where training the next generation of heroes isn't just our jobs -- it's our pleasure!
Origins Unknown: WHO
Origins Unknown: Who
Written by Victor Dandridge
Art by Jacob Newell
Rated B for Bold
#ForTheFansOf: Demo, Runaways, Superman: Earth-One, Wonder Woman: Destiny Calling, and Starman: Sins of the Father!
An homage series of self-contained short stories, following a protagonist's discovery of a hidden heritage or secret talent(s), destined to change their future and possibly the fate of the entire world.
The Trouble w/Love
The Trouble w/LoveWritten by Victor Dandridge
Line Art by Harold Edge
Colors by Ryan Carter
Rated C for Caution
#ForTheFansOf: Saga, Invincible, Spider-Man Blue, Dynamo-5, Jupiter's Legacy, New X-men, and All Star Superman!
Apex Prime, one of the GREATEST heroes of Earth, had a wife and a family...and then he fell in love with someone else.  Now, he must explain how truly human he is to the one person who should know it best -- his own son.
The Samaritan Collected Edition vol. 2
The Samaritan
Written by Victor Dandridge
Art by Ren McKinzie
Rated F for Frank
#ForTheFansOf: Kick-Ass, Punisher: Welcome Back Frank, Kingdom Come, The Dark Knight Returns, Ultimate Spider-man!
Residents of a crime-ridden community find their lives forever changed with the arrival of a mysterious, new tenant called, "Smith."  They suffer under the plague of mankind's inhumanity, but with his extraordinary powers, Smith aims to be the cure.
Wanna see a little bit more?  Check out this issue of On the Horizon, our brand-centric magazine for a few more morsels to whet your whistle!

Now, since we've already covered the initial funding goal, that insures our rewards will be fulfilled, so IF your pledge was purely reward-based, then your receipt is GUARANTEED!  We admit, it's a bit UnConventional -- but that's what we call the V:IP Treatment!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest challenge will be breaking through the wall of so many astounding creative ventures to get some spotlight on our campaign! Kickstarter has become SUCH a funding source for creating comics, that we might get lost in the shuffle. We're tapping a few media sources to help nudge ourselves through, but there is the risk that we won't make as big of a splash as we intend. 

And while we'd like to ensure we respond to every node of support, we're also in the midst of a convention tour that can sometimes make communication sporadic -- we apologize in advance if we don't respond, personally, right away! Know that in no way shape or form does it take away from our appreciation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Empower Learning with U Cre-8 Comics is live AND funded -- but we STILL need YOUR help!
updates.update_content:
Hey my Beautiful Backers!
You all generously backed the From Bits to Books campaign, and I'm hoping that you enjoyed our comics enough to support our newest campaign: Bringing comic book-based, educational material to 2000 students in Central Ohio! 
In only two hours, our newest venture -- with a modest sum of $250, funding distribution to one school (approx. 200 students) hit its goal!  But that was only the first step and we're more than halfway to a greater impact -- funding programming for TEN SCHOOLS!!!
We need all the help we can get to keep our momentum going, so please -- #PledgeIFYouCan #LikeAndShareBECAUSEYouCare!
Ladies and Gents, Victor Dandridge, the #HWMiC here and I've got a question to ask ALL of you:

Books (check), U Cre-8 sets (check), The Samaritan 3-D Print (check), 3-D glasses...(UNCHECK).
It's with DEEP apologies that I have sent out the print book awards -- I'm waiting on the LAST piece gto arrive and that e been on back order for a few weeks!!! But, as soon as they come in, expect to get YOUR reward ASAP!!!!

During the campaign, we marketed The Samaritan series as a seven-issue series, told over three parts. Well, after some careful consideration, we've decided to return it to its original dual-collected versions!!!
Presenting...!

updates.update_userinfo: WE DID IT!!! (As if there was any doubt...!)
Our SECOND Stretch Goal has been ACHIEVED!!
updates.update_content: We've done so much in so little time! It should without saying -- though I'm saying it anyway -- that I SINCERELY appreciate all the love and support given to this project! Your dedication to me is my motivation! Thank you!

Okay...we're in the last stretches, with just DAYS to go before From Bits to Books comes to a close.  But I want to go out just strong as when we started, so I'm setting up a BRAND NEW stretch goal!

$1200 -- At this level we'll have enough to fund the production of Wonder Care #3!!!  So if we push through to hit that goal EVERYONE will receive a free digital copy of our third installment of The Kinder Guardians series!!!

I know we haven't hit the previous goal of $1K (YET), but with YOUR continued support, we assuredly will and why not press for just one more cool piece to add to your collection?!  Again, a countless number of thanks goes out to each and every one of you -- I appreciate all your love and support -- you guys rock all my socks!

campaign.story:
What first started off as a sketch has turned into a MOVEMENT!!!
Some of the characters that kicked off the Trill League project
What is TRILL LEAGUE?
TRILL LEAGUE is an idea that started off with me drawing well-known superheroes but adding a bit of humor and urban edge to them. In the past few months though, it has turned into something bigger than I could have ever imagined. Having sparked hundreds of fan art submissions, becoming a trending topic on Google, and having thousands of shares on Tumblr and Facebook...I am hoping to turn this project up to the next level for fans of this project.
Who are some of the characters?
Blackmayne: Leader of the Trill League. His father (an ex-Black Panther) and mother were killed during a robbery attempt. In order to avenge their death, he has dedicated his life to fighting crime, but instilled with his father's views, he takes "black power" to the extreme by refusing to use anything white. This includes writing on paper, drinking milk, or stepping inside of any building that is white…..but some would believe that he may be secretly attracted to white women. 
Sparrow: Blackmayne's 11 year old bad ass lil' sidekick who is all about having fun and making sure his crime-fighting gear is fresh. He can often be found making sure his uniform match his kicks, doing the 'NaeNae' dance after defeating a criminal, or tweeting hip-hop producers during missions to listen to his mixtape.
Wondeisha: The "First Woman" of Trill League armed with superhuman strength and agility. She's often called ratchet due to her behavior, but no one can ever excuse her of not keeping it real with her teammates (she refuses to fight crime for more than 8 hours a day and mandatory weekends off). She's more concerned with fame and fashion than fighting crime. 
Soul: A pimp who gets one of the most powerful weapons in the universe must now devote his time to not only fighting some of the world's most dangerous villains, BUT also keeping his hoes in check.
Swolemayne: The muscle of the team. With superhuman strength, agility and senses as well as the power of flight, there's not much he can't do. And he will let you know this! With one of the cockiest attitudes on the team and obsessed with his perfect physique, he uses all of this to his advantage to sleep with all the women who throw themselves at him. 
…I'm talking TONS!
What is the premise of the story?
The 1st Volume of the Trill League graphic novel starts off with the Wondeisha/Swolemayne sextape being leaked publicly. As a result, this causes turmoil amongst the team, which allows another superhero team to take over...
…but Blackmayne is suspicious of who is really behind this mysterious new squadron of heroes.  
So what is the purpose of this KICKSTARTER?
As a professional artist, currently working in Hollywood in both animation and comics, producing work for studios requires the majority of my time and I am unfortunately unable to devote my full attention to illustrating the graphic novel I have written for Trill League. I would like to put all of my energy into a product with not only a hilarious and engaging story, but high quality art as well. I also plan to illustrate posters/prints, revise the look of the current cast and develop new characters. The story line for the first graphic novel will have the Trill League going up against the Trillionaires (The Trill version of the Avengers) and also include parodies of other series including One Piece, Naruto, and Power Rangers as well as many hip-hop and urban culture references. 
Powers or no powers during superhero sex?
If this Kickstarter campaign is successful, I can temporarily suspend working for clientele and studios to fully devote energy into this graphic novel project. I will be able to take the art for this project to the next level, flesh out existing characters, create new ones and put together a world where all the characters hilariously interact with each other.
Where will the money go if this campaign is successful?
The initial goal is to raise $7,500 to produce the FIRST 2 ISSUES of the comic series. This will cover time to spend working on the comic and reward items as well as printing and shipping expenses. This is the bare minimum needed. 
The first volume of the graphic novel consists of 6 issues though, so any additional funds above the initial $7,500 will allow me to work on more issues of the comic, as well as collaborate with other talented artists to speed up productivity (see Stretch Goals below). 
A new way to play card games
Many people who have followed the project since its inception, enjoy the comedic writing of the characters and comic strips, and this is something I would love to further develop for people who enjoy this series as well as new readers. I feel this project is a first of its kind, merging both superhero and hip-hop culture in a hilarious story…
...and this is only the beginning.  
Trill League takes hip-hop personalities like Diddy and Iggy Azalea and merges them with popular comic villains
(*all reward items are mock-up designs and the look of the final product will differ)
 STRETCH GOALS TO PRODUCE MORE ISSUES!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any creative project, there is a chance of delay for presenting a final product. The date for delivery of all backer rewards is an estimated date for completion and printing. I will stay persistent in keeping all backers updated on progress of the project and any delays as they arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Final Chance to Update S&H Info
updates.update_content:
Just a final update: if you need to change your shipping address, you have until Thursday to do so. Email me at trillleaguecomics@gmail.com with the name the order was placed under and the new address if you do. 
If your address is the same as when you when you filled out your shipping form, there is no need to update.

Hey guys, here's the latest update:
-I just got confirmation my new shipment will be in next week. I'll begin shipping once they arrive. If anyone needs to change their delivery address, you have a week to do so. I'll be locking all of that info for shipping next week, and since I'll be automating most of the postage, you will not be able to change it after that. 
-Digital copies will be sent out via email once I get every package out the door. I'm trying to keep everyone getting their items as close as possible. Apologies for the inconvenience. 
-There is going to be one question I know that is going to be asked of me when the book is received: This was intentional, but because of how I had to format this updated version of the book for the new printer, there are more pages than I originally intended. The original book was 76 pages. However, the new printer suggested I do multiples of 8 (not 4). Why...I don't know. So 4 more pages were added. I won't go into depth about why this is, because it plays a part into the story as well as the formatting, but just know that it was partially meant to be there.

I wanted to update everyone on where everything is currently at. 
I’m still in the process of settling my issue for the print job. They are “working” to rectify their mistake, but I was given a production date of mid to late November. In the meantime, I’ve just decided to go with another company. I’m still waiting on the final contract, but I was given a date of October 11th. So if everything goes according to plan, (as I am praying it does), it should only be behind for a few more days before I get everything sent out. I'll post an update on the official date once I sign the paperwork.

Sup everyone,
Most of my books have been received. I'm still waiting for the hardcovers, posters, and stickers to arrive. However, I am dealing with an issue with the print job of this order. I've gone through a portion of the books, and a good amount have arrived with the edges frayed/torn. I asked the printer why this is, and they explained to me that the cause is likely because I have heavy spot black ink coverage on a card stock that is not laminated...even though I paid for the lamination. The fraying also gets worse when I open the book, as well as there being some scaring on the cover image. 

At the moment, I'm waiting for their response as to what is going to be done to rectify this issue. I put a lot of time into the presentation of this product for it to look like this. This company was recommended to me by a colleague, however, I am not happy at all with how this looks, especially for how much was paid. 

I apologize for this matter. I assure you I am working to get this taken care of ASAP. I will post the update as soon as we reach a resolution.

I want to first thank everyone for their support for Trill League over these past few years as well as the immense patience everyone has given me toward the completion of these books. This project has opened many opportunities for my career, and I'm grateful that many of you have supported my temporary drifts off-course to explore them.
I also want to thank everyone who placed their preorder. I wasn't expecting the sales to do as well as they did, which now stand at over 1,400 total book copies which will be shipping -- over a 300% increase from when this project debuted. I've put a lot of work into this project, and I'm glad to have these books completed to share with everyone finally. I'm also anxious, just because this book isn't exactly like any of the other material I've released so far -- it's going to be interesting to see how everyone receive it.

What's up, everyone!
I just wanted to send out this message to everyone who either preordered or upgraded any part of their package, that Backerkit will begin processing all charges on Friday, September 7th. I moved the date up from today, Wednesday, September 5th -  in order to give everyone time to make any changes or cancellations to their orders. Items such as the hardcover and t-shirts will be printed based on the exact quantity ordered, so if you do need to cancel your order for any reason, but interested in purchasing at a later time, please contact me through email for arrangements. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact me by email: trillleaguecomics@gmail.com. I will be extremely attentive to all messages sent over the next 48 hours. Thanks!

campaign.story:
We are working to complete the first Urban Myth graphic novel, and we need your help to finish the task.  The graphic novel is currently planned to be at least 75 pages and will consist of a collection of Urban Myth stories delivered by a great group of artists.  Our project goal will allow us to complete the art and editing of the graphic novel.
As a backer, you become part of the team and help us decide things, and if you choose, you can even create a place for yourself in the mythology.
For millennia, select individuals have been given a gift of cosmic proportions. In our history, those granted with this tremendous power have walked the earth as heroes and gods.
These uncanny women and men have been worshiped, feared, hunted and immortalized in lore.  Their stories have been chronicled in the varied mythologies of the world.  Overtime the legacies of Isis, Odin, Aries, Raiden, and others have become legend and fairy tales almost forgotten.
Today a new era begins as the supernatural cycle renews. New mythologies will be born, and it all starts on a street block in your city. 
The pages of Urban Myth are filled with heroes and villains who reflect our world. Stories and artists include:

The Gifting with art by Paulo Barrios
Our story begins with “The Gifting” which introduces us to a mixed family given the powers once embodied by the gods of Greek and Roman mythology. The block will change forever with the arrival of the New Olympians. As a reward, The Gifting is represented in whole as an independent comic book and also part of the collection of stories in the graphic novel. This story is drawn by the super talented Paulo Barrios, a sure star in the making.
The Pride with art by Eric Battle
In “The Pride” we have the first sparks of international conflict between the new gods of Urban Myth. In the lush mountains of Jamaica, the Aeis of Norse Mythology are reestablished. The Pride of new gods are quickly forced to test themselves against a rival group intent on murder. This story is drawn by the amazing Eric Battle, an industry veteran of incredible ability. Eric’s credits include comic’s biggest titles such as Batman, JLA, Aquaman and the X-Men titles.
Gods of War with art by Raymund Bermudez
War is big business, and business has always been good. And in the world of Urban Myth, these guys have the monopoly. Gods of War is drawn by the incredible Raymund Bermudez. "Berms" is another rising superstar.
Sword Maidens with art by Gerardo Sandoval, Roc Upchurch, Ace Continuado and more.
The Sword Maidens are the first hero collective in the world of Urban Myth.  This section is a gallery to highlight the leading female heroes of the Urban Myth world, power players at the heart of everything we do. Each hero introduces themselves over art by a collection of outstanding artists. 
Epic with art by Kim Jacinto
This is an all-age story, suitable for young children and enjoyable by the whole family. The story features the three youngest New Olympians as they start to learn the ropes of crime-fighting . Epic is represented in whole as an independent comic/creative workbook and also part of the collection of stories in the graphic novel Art provided by the multitalented Kim Jacinto, a Marvel prospect.
Pantheon with art by Paulo Barrios
Pantheon is a continuation of the dream.  This story picks up right where the Graphic Novel leaves off and Paulo and I are anxiously hoping to hit the stretch goals to allow us to go deeper into this world with you.
Urban Myth is as diverse as the Mythologies that have influenced it.  From our international team of artists to the global scope of our characters, Urban Myth is truly as multicultural as our world.  Imagination and cultural relevance are key drivers for creator Raymond Ayala.

"I've been building this universe since I was eight years old, and it's always been about telling cool stories.  Urban Myth is about imagination and possibilities, the multiculturalisms just happen.  Each concept grows organically, evolving through an integrating of elements from my environments, surrounding cultures, and history.  My passion is rooted in my belief that together with fans and other creators, we can build something great from the ground up that reflects the world we live in."

All of our comics will be available in both English and Spanish.  There is also the potential for other translations so please contact us about having the comics translated into your language.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Production delays happen and have been considered in the delivery projections. Of course, I understand that the coordination and production of the final product with an international team may still hit some snags. The #1 lesson learned from my 1st kickstarter campaign is that communication is key and I expect to utilize backer updates to keep our supporters up-to-speed and engaged as much as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey all,
I'm quite honored to share that this past weekend I was awarded the Glyph Comics Rising Star Award for Best Self-Publisher. To win an award for my first published comic is humbling and I was quite surprised. I take great pride in the quality of the books and to be recognized for it was amazing. I can tell you all that Urban Myth is twice as good as my first book! So I'm hoping for Story of the Year next year!

campaign.story:
New Rewards! (see below)
The Story in a Nutshell
Distractions is the story of Gill, a failed bodyguard who realizes that his quest to revenge the assassination of his client is nothing but a desperate attempt to avoid dealing with both the death of his wife and with taking on the scariest challenge he will ever face…fatherhood.
Click here for a 40 page sample!
Set against the backdrop of a near future Chicago that has returned to the dark days of violence, corruption, and organized crime that defined the Windy City in the 1920’s and 1930’s, Distractions is a thriller with noir-ish undertones.
Gill's journey poses questions about moral ambiguity, loyalty, and personal responsibility. This is a story about recognizing the distractions we cling to, to avoid dealing with the most painful parts of life, and finding the courage to let those painful experiences change us and mold us into better people.
The Project
Distractions is a graphic novel told in 4 parts. Each of the 4 parts is being released separately in digital formats. The print edition will contain all 4 parts as well as some great additional "behind the scenes" material. 
Parts 1 & 2 are finished! With your support we can finish Parts 3 & 4.
The book is  colored in a "reverse Wizard of Oz" style. The first part, before the murder of Gill’s wife, is in full color, but the majority of Gill’s story is told using a very muted palette to reflect his emotional state. There are a few important pops of color that break through Gill’s grey-colored haze, but full-color will only return if Gill can find a way out of the labyrinth of distractions he’s hiding in.
Distractions was designed from the ground up to look great not only on the printed page, but as a digital comic presented on small screens like the iPhone and other hand-held devices. Each page (maybe “screen” is a better word) is drawn with a “wide-screen”  aspect ratio to take full advantage of the screen real-estate. 
The text and the artwork were designed to be clear on even the oldest "smart phone". 
This would be a "screen"....
Two "screens" make one page in the print edition.
Although the guiding concept of the project is “digital before print,” print considerations were always kept in mind. For example, each of the first 3 chapters is 44 “screens” long, and as two screens stack nicely to fit a traditional comic page, it works out to 22 pages. The 4th chapter will come in at a higher page count as there is too much climactic awesomeness to contain in 22 pages!
Maza is already hard at work on Part 3! Click to see more.
The Team
Wes Sturdevant is obsessed with story. His passion to become a storyteller led him from his home town of Bloomington, IN, to Chicago where he studied at Columbia College Chicago, and earned a BA in film production followed by an MFA in fiction writing. Distractions is one of a number of graphic literature projects he is developing. He is also working on other writing projects for both children and adults. His off-beat supernatural thriller Dirt Bird is available from Amazon and from ebook retailers including Apple, Barnes & Noble, Sony, and Amazon.
Wes lives in Indianapolis, where his lovely wife, darling baby girl, affectionate cat, and irrepressible three-legged mutt, somehow find a way to tolerate him.
You can learn more about Wes and what he’s up to at: www.storyandmedia.net
Maza (aka Milorad Vicanovic) is an extremely efficient and prolific illustrator whose talent and versatility allows him to do illustrations for books and magazines, as well as comics. Besides Distractions, he is currently working on two graphic novels for French publishers; Wunderwaffen for Soleil and Lady Spitfire for Delcourt. His comic portfolio includes Triangle Rose, and two tomes of the Vekovnici graphic novel series and he is the creator of The Uninvited Hero. Maza also organizes Salon Stripa Laktasi, an annual comic festival that gathers together the most important artists from the Balkans.
Maza lives in Laktasi, Bosnia and Herzegovina, where his wife and two sons occasionally let him use his computer. If you ask him why he is an artist he will tell you, “There's no life without drawing and breathing.”
You can see more of his work here: http://mazastrip.blogspot.com
The Money
What will we do with the money? 
Achieving our $3000 goal will make a nice dent in the myriad of expenses involved in producing Distractions. This includes covering all of the costs involved in producing and delivering those sweet backer rewards, as well as some of the tools (both physical and digital) that Maza and I use in creating the book. If we exceed our goal we are likely to blow the additional money on Gatorade to replenish the electrolytes lost via the sweat equity we have, and will continue to, put into this project. Maza might also use some of the money to feed his cat.
Maza's cat thinks you should back Distractions!
You can find out more about the project and the creators at www.storyandmedia.net 
Please note that Distractions is intended for mature readers
New Rewards!
Distractions is not the only collaboration between Maza and I. He and I have been working together on a 23 page children's picture book titled Clever Little Hermes. It’s my retelling of the classic myth about how the infant Hermes (the Greek messenger god) pulled a clever prank on his brother Apollo (the sun god). The Illustrations are a collaboration between Maza, who did the drawings, and Ozren Miždalo, who colored and textured them.
The book is nearly finished. Ozren is completing the colors on the last pages now and I expect it to be done and in print by the end of the summer.
Through a special arrangement with Maza and Ozren, I’m now able to offer backers of the Distractions Kickstarter advance copies of both the paperback print edition and a PDF edition of Clever Little Hermes!
I tried my best to keep the new rewards simple. Basically, you can upgrade most reward levels to include a paperback print copy of Clever Little Hermes for an additional $15. There are also options for getting more than one print copy and an option to receive a PDF copy.
Already a backer?
If you are already a backer and you would like to adjust your pledge to get your advance copy/copies of Clever Little Hermes, all you have to do is use the “Manage Your Pledge” button, adjust your pledge amount, and choose the reward you would like.
Thanks for taking the time to check out Distractions and the new Clever Little Hermes rewards!

VINCE WHITE PRESENTS: THE ACTION PACK one shot! The world of WILL POWER is opening up and THE ACTION PACK are key players! They Debuted in issue three of THE LEGEND OF WILL POWER!
They are the nation's premier teen super group! Among their cast are: BOY FEARLESS, ELEMENT GIRL, THE QUIVER KID, ROUGH-DRAFT, and SKETCH!
Like their name, they pack a lot of action and heroic, last minute saves! They protect the nation and our globe from carnal threat! Find out how the team was formed, how they came to be, and the secret behind their construction! Some capes cover a dark truth! Find out in DARKLIGHT COMICS PRESENTS: THE ACTION PACK!
This will be our FIRST COLOR COVER! (cover by MANTIS STUDIOS http://mantisstudio.deviantart.com/ ) and the beginning of a new trend! Come see for yourself the wild new universe that awaits. These are NEW HEROES FOR A NEW MILLENNIUM!  Learn more http://willpowercomic.com
I really hope you are just as excited as I am about this project! I debuted the LEGEND OF WILL POWER one year ago this month. The buzz and sales for the book have been crazy! Thanks to all of you who believe in Great Classic Comic books with great classic comic book HEROES like WILL POWER! I assure you that the ACTION PACK are just as CLASSIC! In issue three of THE LEGEND OF WILLPOWER, WILLIAM comes face to face with this dynamic Teen Super Group in a battle that opens even more of the WILLPOWER/DARKLIGHT UNIVERSE up!
I have composed a POWERFUL creative team for this title. My guess is they will blow your minds. They are:
BOB FRANTZ, CHRISTOPHER BAIRD, from PRIMAL PAPER and LEONARDO COLAPIETRO, MARCO PAGNOTTA, and ADREA MICHELSANTI
from MANTIS STUDIOS http://mantisstudio.deviantart.com/
SO LETS MAKE IT HAPPEN!!!! donate today!!!
-Be POWERFUL!
Vince
